Reviews.Title: “Attentive service, perfect location, great amenities!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimo B
Reviews.Content: Attentive desk staff, invisible but effective housekeeping, plentiful amenities (turn down & chocolates, slippers, 24 hr coffee/tea/espresso & biscuits, even an open air terrace on a little canal for late night coffee or wine!), GREAT location (steps left to San Marco and designer shopping, steps right to the theater and tons of trattoria's). Enjoyed 5 minute walks in the evening to gelato, and dueling orchestra's in SM piazza! The triple room was compact (low celings felt like a cruise ship cabin) but efficient, double bed and minibar/fridge in one room, single bed & cute sitting area in other room - each had own bathroom & shower, which was NICE! Breakfast was continental, plentiful and serviced well by the staff, even after 3 cappuccino's!! We splurged for private water taxi's right to their dock coming & going, but water taxi's will get you a 5 min walk close. 5 stars for location, 4 star service, 3.5 stars for accommodations (by spoiled US standards). A solid 4 & well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: BluediverManchester
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel purely from the great reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. It was a surprise 50th Birthday present for my partner and our first time in Venice. I organised a shared water taxi direct from the airport ( Â£25 each) and there was plenty of space with 4 other couples. We were dropped off at the pier closest to our hotel and it was a challenge to locate the hotel, but we managed it eventually ( we were later advised that the taxi diver should ideally escort us to the hotel door direct ). The hotel is charming and full of character and as there had been a cancellation we were offered a room with balcony overlooking a picturesque canal way.Although small, the room was adequate and tastefully decorated.The singing Gondoliers travelled up and down the canal frequently and it was such a happy atmosphere. A nice touch was the hot drinks and snacks facilities on the first floor where you could help yourself at any time. Breakfast was pleasant and there was plenty of choice and although the breakfast room was small it was still enjoyable and one morning we ate on the small jetty by the canal which was a treat. Now on to the Happy Hospitality ! Mrs Anna and Massimo are a credit to the establishment and although neither are the owners , they genuinely aim to guarantee a wonderful break. On my partners Birthday, Massimo secretly organised a private Gondola which picked us up direct from the hotel jetty ( a little bit pricey, I thought, at 110 euro )and gave us a bottle of champagne 'on the house' to accompany us ! A lovely touch by the hotel and the trip was worth every euro ! Massimo also organised a free trip to the island of Murano where we had a tour of the glass factory, another lovely day out! I would definitely recommend this hotel to all who travel to Venice and I hope to return one day.Big thank you Mrs Anna and Massimo :-)

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate...it's all true.”
Reviews.Author: phylva
Reviews.Content: Sept. 2011. we are 3 middle age women, friends vacationing (husbands at home), American, but one originally from Europe..executive, business and physican backgrounds. My first trip to Venice. I wanted to experience all the charm of San Marco but I like clean, comfortable and upscale accommodations as well. We all agree that the Hotel Becher more than delivered. Massimo and Anna were delightful! Family owned and managed says it all. It has charm, comfort, safety, ambiance and is very nicely located. The water access is a nice feature, particularly when arriving/departing with luggage .Use the water taxi (so simple!) We shared a room for 3 (3 twins) but without canal view. I'm sure that would have been nice but didn't miss it. We would all return to the Hotel Becher, especially if still family run. Massimo wears many hats and was incredibly accommodating, informative and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little place!”
Reviews.Author: classicalmusictravel
Reviews.Content: I arrived exhausted and this place revived me. Excellent welcoming at the front desk and room ready ahead of time. I had a small but perfectly adequate room on the first floor with a window looking out to a tiny canal, complete with gondoliers singing as they went by. The staff is first rate--Massimo helped me with my free internet connection (It's 12 euros a day at the Europa and Regina). He also helped me call my credit card company when I had a problem. Way beyond the call of duty and happy to help and knowledgeable. The breakfast was lovely--large assortment of meats, breads, jams, and so forth with coffee made for you the way you like it. The whole place was quiet and other guests were considerate. If you're looking for a true Venetian experience rather than a 5 star hotel, this is the place for you. Thank you Hotel Becher!

Reviews.Title: “Charming room along the canal with few faultsâ€�”
Reviews.Author: BradJill
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for Carnevale 2012 and booked a room with Hotel Becher 4 months in advance. They offer discounts for prepaid bookings but charge additional for the canal view, so it turned out about the same cost for a 3 nights' stay. The hotel may be difficult to find at first but it has a very good location, 5 minutes from St Mark's Square, and La Fenice Theatre is just around the corner. We arrived around noontime and check in was easy, staff were friendly and helpful, and wifi was free. We stayed in a double room along the canal and got the room we expected. Two sizable windows which afforded a view of gondolas passing by (and they frequently do especially in the afternoon), and gondoliers singing - a nice treat. This was the cliche we were hoping for and got it. Size-wise we were happy with the room space, and the bed (which was a proper double) was comfortable. We had problems with the safe on the 1st night, and couldnt use it thereafter. The bathroom was heavily scented to our liking (fortunately this went away during the course of our stay) and occasionally there was an unpleasant smell of drainage - probably not unexpected in Venice, and this did not last. Breakfast area was small but didn't get crowded when we went. We enjoyed their breakfast buffet a lot. This included the traditional carnevale pastry, one of the better fritellis we tried while in Venice. And their chocolate muffins were yummm! It was too cold to have breakfast on the boat landing during winter but it offered a nice place to chill out in the evening. It is generally pricey to stay in Venice, especially during Carnevale, and Hotel Becher is no exception. Their pricing however seems at par with other hotel rooms with canal view that we were looking into. As we got the stereotypical Venetian accommodations we were aiming for we were quite happy with our stay, and would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: sarah_gray
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Becherend Nov beginning of Dec 11 for a suprise for my husband for our 3rd wedding anniversary. I was hoping that it would be special enough to remember and it was! Its a lovely hotel, with traditional Venician style decoration in a great location. The hotel is very clean, including the rooms and bathrooms. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were lovely and warm which was a much needed as it was very cold but lovely and sunny during our visit! We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel to be in such a good location - 5 mins from St Marks - 10/15 mins from Rialto etc but we tended to go off the beaten track more than the main attractins and the good thing about Hotel Becher's location is that it's easy to find after a day of exploring!! The staff were friendly and helpful - particularly the receptionist and she even up graded us to a room with a balcony overlooking the canal which was wonderful to look out over first thing in the morning! The hotel was quiet so we could get some much needed rest and relaxation after our days of wandering the streets of Venice! Our room was spacious enough but not huge - it wasn't an issue for us as we were out all day and again in the evenings and literally used it as a base - why wouldn't you in such a beautiful city!!! If you had more than one suitcase then you may struggle to not trip over them! That may have just been the room we stayed in so worth asking room size before discounting. Thebathroom was a good size too with plenty of hot water and towels. The only thing - which i think i saw mentioned on here in reviews - is the breakfast. Its not bad - please don't be discouraged - its just not great! There was plenty of selection of sweet cakes and breads etc - all too sweet for me - just a personal taste. Plenty of tea and coffee too. Fruit juices were a bit odd! The orange was like squash not fresh juice. I would have a selection of cheeses and meats instead for breakfast which was perfectly acceptable! The breakfast room is quite small and cosy but again its breakfast before you head out to a beautiful city so i really wouldn't hold it against the hotel! The only time I suppose it could be an issue is high season and would they fit everyone in if they all turned up for breakfast at the same time! Anyway - we would definately go back to the Hotel Becher without hesitation. It gave us some great memories in a quiet but very convenient location at a really good price. It really did help make a perfect 3 night break for us and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend if you are visiting Venice and want a warm, comfy base for your exploring! Venice is a beautiful city and perfect at the time of year we went - a very romantic and enjoyable trip

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Gem in great location, but spulrge on a water taxi to get here”
Reviews.Author: JML35805
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher was amazing, classically decorated in gorgeous ornate Venetian decor, with extremely nice staff who bent over backwards to please you, SO NICE. Our room was huge, and bathroom was great, our views were of another building, but we were in close walking distance to St. Marks and everything in that area. We flew into the Venetian airport and hired a water taxi and he said "because of high waters" he couldn't taxi directly to our hotel (when we paid well over $100 US for this taxi)- so he dropped us off at the beginning of what is truly a maze of hallway- sized cobblestone streets to get to our hotel. The staff there said they were being lazy and should've taken us directly to their hotel port, so if you take a water taxi, insist that they do!! It is extremely hard to find on foot, and I speak Italian :) Also, take advantage of the free water taxi Hotel BEcher offers to Murano Island- amazing, pretty much free day trip that kept costs down for nighttime!

Reviews.Title: “Good, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: 5252orange
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was the selling point. It's not the cheapest, but very little in the area is. It's on a nice, quiet smaller lane, but still a 5-10 minute walk to either San Marco Square or the Rialto area. The breakfast buffet was a nice spread and the staff was all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LindaetMichel
Reviews.Content: This beautiful Hotel is perfectly located, just minutes away from St Mark's Square. When we visited last February, we arrived at Hotel Becher quite late. The person working had been waiting for us and was very friendly. I think we might have woken him up, we where really really late. We decided to go explore Venice and we had an amazing time. We were wondering the streets of what looked like a ghost town, no people, no lights, no sound...Just us. We were so close to St Mark's Square that we just happened to get there not even knowing were it was yet. What an amazing experience to get to stand in the middle of St Mark's Square, all by ourselves!!!This hotel is locked at night and you need to get buzzed in. He did not have an issue with us getting back at 4h00 am although some people might have been annoyed by tourists that keep interrupting there sleep. The rooms were very spacious, and beautifully decorated. If I ever get the chance to Return to this wonderful city, I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Becher again.

Reviews.Title: “Massimiliano is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Escapader
Reviews.Content: Have had trouble with booking our stay with Hotel Becher because of flight cancellations etc. and Massimiliano has been very understanding, and has had no hesitation in helping us. If this is the type of service you get when you are no doubt being a difficult customer (as we have), imagine the service you would get if you actually get to visit Hotel Becher!!! We cant wait to be able to visit one day Massimiliano! (if you will have us!) Sorry I cannot comment on the actual hotel, but I will one day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: BlanaidH
Reviews.Content: Plush, warm, spacious room with big windows that opened right on to the canal. There were shutters for total darkness too, and a bath, which made me very happy! Great service - lovely reception staff. Fantastic location...

Reviews.Title: “Excellant service”
Reviews.Author: sporadic
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellant service. Massimo (hope that's spelt right), took really good care of us. The breakfast is awesome The rooms are small, but thats normal for Venice. Its close to St Mark's square, but quiet. Get a room facing the canal

Reviews.Title: “3* No Way”
Reviews.Author: crd2011
Reviews.Content: We booked The Hotel Becher on Trip adviser recommendations. What a joy! It is just a few streets away from San Marco and the square with gondola's passing the jetty all the time. You can see and hear the tenor voices as they pass by. Your welcome is so friendly, helpful and genuine. A 3* rating might be for the accomodation which is very venetian and ornate, very clean including hotel toilets and communal areas. However, you are treated as a 5* guest. We went to celebrate a friends birthday. The Owner arranged a private breakfast for 4 of us on our landing, at no charge. They then said the would send a surprise to their room: it was an ice bucket of Prosseco and with strawberries and nibbles, again with four glasses, compliments of the management. Rooms do vary, however spotlessly clean. We stayed in 206, the only thing I would say is there is a light directly in the courtyard outside, so close one of the outside shutters; the corridor lights do not work later in the evening, so finding your room can be difficult. However that very well have been us not working out the system. It is total value for money, where staff will go that extra mile. A wonderful hotel, an amazing location in the most beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AppyTravels
Reviews.Content: From the moment my husband and I walked into this hotel, we knew it would be just like the pictures we saw on the internet. There is so much charm about Hotel Becher. From the warm welcome at reception to the Venetian decorated rooms. There is nothing bad to say about this hotel. It was in a great location, only a 5-7 minute walk to San Marco square and all the wonder of the centre of Venice. Cafes and restaurants are plentiful and the shops are amazing. The room itself was wonderful. The room was spacious and the bathroom was big too. The breakfast was delicious and the internet easily accessible and fast. Overall, Hotel Becher is a Venetian gem and I will certainly recommend it to my friends and family, as well as staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yv_Abd
Reviews.Content: Excellent location only 5 min from St. Marco Water Taxi dock. Madam Anna and her staffs were friendly. Extremely helpful with maps, sightseeing advice and restaurant info. Breakfast was excellent. We had the canal view from our room. The rooms were beautiful with every detail taken care of. My kids enjoyed sitting by the window watching the gondolas passing by. Madam Anna arranged a free water taxi for a tour of the Murano Glass Factory. The trip was just fantastic. Free wifi in the room helped a lot. The hotel has a landing for water taxi making it convenient to charter a water taxi directly to the main port.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms look like do on the website”
Reviews.Author: VickyChristinaBCN
Reviews.Content: First thing's first: there are no less than SIX streets in Venice with the same street name. Please do your research and make sure you are headed to the right one! I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, and I would like to warn those considering staying here, that not all rooms look like they do on the website. Reading again through the reviews now, it seems like everyone who did not enjoy their stay, ended up in the same room. When they led us into our room, I was a very disappointed, as this was the most we were spending for a night in our European travels - this was suppossed to be a special "treat". It was small, with no view like what is advertised, and I felt like we were kind of tucked away in their most undesirable spot. The view we did have was of the building's basement next door, which was undergoing renovations. The included breakfast also left a bit to be desired if you wanted something other than cookies, pastries, cheese or ham. However, reception was very helpful in finding a great place to have dinner, and went out of their way with any tourist information. But I would advise anyone wanting a romantic stay in Venice to perhaps do some more research and find a better place to stay. Definitely not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: NCItaliaphiles
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher is located 5 minutes by foot from Piazza San Marco. The back side faces a small canal frequently traversed by gondolas. You can request a canal facing room (expect to pay more). The rooms not facing the canal are nice enough and in that you are in Venice, there's no reason to spend much time there anyway. So settle for having your breakfast on the small landing outside the lobby watching the boats go by. The staff was great, helpful and warm and ready with advice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: Denyson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located close to piazza san marco. Internet is free and good. The bed is terrible and room in general is OK (a little small). Breakfast is included and very good. TV channels are very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LadyDiY
Reviews.Content: Good location and wonderful front desk people. Breakfast buffet could be improved. Room was large and comfortable, but drapes don't close to block light.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, view of a wall”
Reviews.Author: evabvictoria
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for one night only during our honeymoon. Upon arrival, the staff was very friendly and helpful. However, when they led us into our room I was a bit disappointed, as we spent about $300 on this room, and it was small, with no view like what is advertised, and I felt like we were kind of tucked away in their most undesirable spot. That being said, the staff was extremely nice, and we had such a great time hanging out on the hotels deck outside on the canal when we got back to the hotel after dinner. The room itself, although small, had flawless wifi, a nicely appointed bathroom with hot hot water, and fresh fluffy towels. Upon checkout, I waited in line for quite some time while the woman helping other customers gave them the royal treatment. I felt fairly overlooked here, but the canal deck made up for it, which is why I am giving this hotel a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Becher lives up to its reputation!”
Reviews.Author: LuvTOtravel06560
Reviews.Content: Our arrival into Venice was delayed until close to midnight. As our water taxi neared the hotel landing in the dark of night, I was relieved to see someone waiting there for us! A beacon in the night. All of the staff were very helpful and cheerful during our 3-day stay. Our room had all the necessities, was very quiet, and clean. The elevator was a blessing with our 3 large suitcases in tow. We had to wait a bit for a table for breakfast but we didn't mind since we were not on a schedule. We loved sitting out on the landing overlooking the canal -- all of the tourists would wave like crazy to us! It is a great location (shopping and restaurants very close and easy walk to Piazza San Marco) and the hotel is a very good value. We definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Flick_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. We are very happy with the politeness and friendliness of the receptionists. We also got a free ride to Murano through the arrangement by hotel. The room is small but comfortable. The only down was the room temperature was too high and a but stuffy. When we tried to open the door to improve the air flow in the room, we realized that we had allowed mosquitoes in and we got bitten badly on first night till we realized! Besides, the cleaner didn't refill our bath soap daily too. We had to request it on the third day when we had completely ran out. Breakfast was good. A good variety of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Alison K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Becher in January and were up graded to a canal view room for no extra cost. For my husband and I it made the weekend. We were traveling with 3 teenage children and their room was a little small but it is Venice. The breakfast was nice, continental fruit and yoghurt, cerials etc and excellent coffee. The location was geat and the children could wander off with map in hand. Getting lost being half the fun. The staff were very helpful and arranged a trip for us to the Murano glass factories obligation free. You weren't restricted to the factory of their choice and we could have spent all day there but we were on a schedule. There were plenty of restaurants near by and the staff's recomendations were spot on. On the day of our departure we were one child short. She had became lost on the way back to the hotel after making a quick dash to get last minute souvenirs, took a left instead of a right. The receptionst was fantastic and constantly in contact with our water taxi driver (who also took us to Murano.) Thanks to their we were able to find the missing family member and made the train.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Fun”
Reviews.Author: Kristen B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Becher for 3 nights in September. Venice was the first stop on our honeymoon. The Hotel Becher started things off right. The breakfast in the morning was small, but very tasty. Good coffee and great crossiants, along with cereals, fruit, as well at meats and cheeses. Massimo the gentleman at the desk was great! He gave us great tips on where to eat, and helped us get a free water taxi to Murano. The room was on the smaller side (but what room isn't in europe), and the bed was very firm (again, an european standard). Other than that, everything was very clean, and lovely. We would definately stay here again if we ever make it back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Very Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Blooms65
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel off the beaten path. Pay the extra and get a room over looking the small canal, you won't regret it as there is lots of gondola activity during the day and you have a great view of watching the men singing beautiful Italian songs, some had squeeze boxes. The staff are very nice but I must admit I had a hard time understanding a couple of them. They are quick to help if you have any problems. The young man carried our bags upstairs as we decided to take the 2 person elevator to the 3rd floor. The room was large and very nice, extra clean but I did find the bed uncomfortable hard. The lighting in the bathroom isn't the best and the water pressure isn't great also the hot and cold aren't consistant, be aware when the toilet flushes. The breakfast is a typical Italian type and the breakfast room is small and tight. If the weather is nice, try snagging the little table out on the landing. It's easy to get lost in Venice even though names are posted on many of the corner buildings, we were unsure if the name was a street, region or canal name....take your pick. Get a good map and drop bread crumbs as you walk along. The little alleys are narrow and buildings are quite tall so you can't tell which way you are going because you often don't see the sun and so many of the landmarks look a like. All in all we had a wonderful time and Venice is lovely with so much history.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional room”
Reviews.Author: johncherylb
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 nights at Hotel Becher. The location is fantastic, close to Saint Mark's but still walking distance to ferry stop on other side of Venice to Murano. We had a canal view room and it was lovely and light and made out Venice experience as we could hear the musicians passing on the gondolas below. Breakfast was lovely and always fresh, and all staff we found very helpful, with good english. Our only small complaint would be lack of water pressure when showering, but location and lovely room made up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: JamieG166
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of pics of this hotel online and I would say they are all VERY accurate. The location of the hotel makes it easy to get around. The staff is very nice. Had issues with the AC called down at 3am and someone came right up and helped me with it, it was something I was doing wrong. The breakfast is nice and hot in the morning and the hours are convenient. I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: bling69
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here in June. Great location close to St Mark's, and hidden in a backstreet. Staff very helpful. good size room Fun breakfast on the small landing watching the gondolas go by

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Becher is just what we hoped for...”
Reviews.Author: reginew33
Reviews.Content: Anna and Massimiliano ("Massimo") welcomed us at the water taxi landing with smiles and so much warmth that we felt we had known each other for years. Our party of six arrived before the official check-in time but they were very happy to store our mountain of luggage and assured us that they would ready our rooms as quickly as possible for our 3-night stay. They gave us maps of the city, made wonderful suggestions for places to eat and excursions we might take, and how to navigate the vaporettos. In short, they just made us feel so comfortable. The rooms were immaculate. We appreciated the elevator and the free WiFi connection as well as the complimentary breakfasts. One day we picked up paninis for lunch and brought them back to the hotel where Anna and Massimo helped us set up the two tables on the canal landing so we could dine al fresco and watch the gondolas glide by. We will never forget our happy stay at Hotel Becher in beautiful Venice or the wonderful Anna and Massimo.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: moneypenny71
Reviews.Content: I would not have any hesitaton in reccommending this hotel, the staff - Massimo & Anna couldn't have been more friendy & helpful, the rooms were clean & beautifully furnished. It was in a perfect location to visit all the main attractions by foot & the nearest ferry stop was at St Marks Square only 5 minutes away. Overall it was a very pleasant stay & one of the best hotel experieces we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: PHatton
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel in a good area of Venice. Just off the heavy tourist paths but only a few minutes walk to all the sights. Our room was quite small but the bathroom was spacious and all impeccably clean. Breakfast is substantial, if a little cramped on the ground floor. There is another breakfast room upstairs in an almost-corridor, which feels a little strange. The staff were all nice, mending my partner's hat when it broke and asking how we were. When we asked the night manager for a restaurant recommendation he didn't really understand what we meant, which was a little disappointing. Definite tip: Get up EARLY and see the sunrise and St Mark's square empty. 6am in August and we had the place to ourselves which was lovely. Then go over the Rialto bridge to the Rialto markets before heading back to the hotel for breakfast. When you're in St Mark's Square later on you'll marvel at how you had it all to yourselves earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at Becher”
Reviews.Author: KarinLee
Reviews.Content: Myself and friend and our two daughters (age 20) stayed at Hotel Becher for 2 nights. I am wishing we had stayed much longer. The rooms were lovely, clean, spacious and comfy beds. The breakfasts were exceptionally good, the little balcony that sits over the canal provded us with hours of entertainment, the service was excellent with the manager answering numerous questions and giving us loads of directions and recommedations. Massimo was so polite and both he and the Manager were by far the best service we received in Italy. Location was fantastic and easy to find and very close to everything. We loved it and would recommend it to everyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - Becher - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VipulDalal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good hotel, however, to find the hotel was quite difficult. But, I think, it was due to new area and the concept of boats to travel to correct station. Rest the staff was very polite and helpful. Overall excellent. In case I go again, maybe book the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Becher”
Reviews.Author: Maralyn C
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel because of excellent service, comfortable room, excellent breakfast and great location. The staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. I left a pair of shoes in the hotel room and the manager shipped them home to me in Australia. We thought the hospitality very good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect.”
Reviews.Author: KatieSusan
Reviews.Content: I booked one night here in hotel becher for a surprise for my boyfriends birthday. We were staying with family nearby in lido de jesolo so only stayed the one night. Everything was perfect. We were very generously upgraded for free to another room at check in. All of the staff were more than happy to help and answer many questions. The bedroom was immaculate, completely clean and comfortable , not forgetting the beautiful decor. Breakfast was included and we were able to sit outside on the little terrace/waterboat stop to eat breakfast which was beautiful. The price i feel was fair for the standard of the hotel but dont know if it would be affordable for more than a long weekend depending on how much you would like to spend, but for one night near st marks square i felt i had a complete bargain. Overall we completely enjoyed our stay, I hope to visit again soon as this hotel is very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gaga1940
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I stayed here for the finale of our five week journey. I chose this hotel because of ratings and location, it did not disappoint us. It is beautiful, the breakfast was excellent, everyone is so friendly and helpful, the location, near St Marks Square, is perfect. A short walk to the waterbus. Quite area, our rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. Sit on the patio and watch the gondolas go by, peaceful. I highly recommend this hotel, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with great view!”
Reviews.Author: ginavtob
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with outstanding customer service. Our hotel room had a view of gondolas passing by which we loved!

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B near St. Mark's square”
Reviews.Author: dtravelerguy
Reviews.Content: First of all don't attempt to walk here from the train station if you have luggage. Just get on the #1 or #2 vaperetto outside the train station going towards St. Mark's square. This place is right by the square, with lots of restaurants in the area. Our room had a canal view, but it's not worth it because you get a tiny room (they did warn us before we checked in). Our only complaint was that we had to checkout 10 minutes before breakfast started and they made no effort to accommodate us. So we didn't get a breakfast we paid for. Also, if you haven't been to Venice be prepared for it to be very crowded during the day and for everything to be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Molto bene! As in - Super!”
Reviews.Author: ClassicalEd
Reviews.Content: Elegant, comfy, friendly, well-kept, well-located... do yourself a favor and STAY HERE when in Venice. For our four-person family group we found our stay at the Becher, in the middle of a long European vacation, to be a happy oasis. High-ceilinged rooms, amenities, gondoliers outside the window (but nothing noisier, really), Murano-glass chandelier and Empire-style wallpaper provided pampered ambience, the intimate size and impeccable housekeeping provided the relaxed and cared-for feeling we needed. Clearly they take pride in providing an excellent property, and they do so without "attitude." We walked, easily, to a wide range of sights and activities, and appreciated the relatively quiet feel of this still-central "street." The worst that could be said -- and this is quibbling indeed -- was the small breakfast area and somewhat (as is common) limited offerings, but we certainly managed, and with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Understated charm, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: wudia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days just before Christmas. We booked this hotel primarily because it was one of the few options at the (relatively) lower end of the price scale near Piazza San Marco, and were really pleasantly surprised by its understated charm. Location is great - 10 minutes walking distance to vaporetto stop, Piazza San Marco, Accademia etc., but on a quiet street a stone's throw from La Fenice. The price was about excellent compared to everywhere else we looked around this area. In retrospect, I am very glad we chose to stay in this part of town, rather than a nicer hotel for the same price further out because - at least during a short stay - you're likely to be spending most of your time very close to this area. The hotel itself feels a little small (the breakfast room certainly is!), and the decor might seem a tad retro to some tastes, but it's clean, cozy, cheerful - and comfortable. Most importantly, the staff are fantastic and go out of their way to be helpful. As an example - the day we left Venice the streets were completely flooded by the acqua alta. The man at the counter gave us some plastic boot-type things to wear over our shoes as we walked to the vaporetto. We tried to pay for the shoes, which cost 5-10 euros in the shops, but he wouldn't let us as long as we agreed to come back again. It may be a long time before we take him up on that, but I hope other tripadvisor users do instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel we loved it”
Reviews.Author: 55pinchy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the good reviews on trip advisor.It was a very good choice.The staff were very friendly and helpful.It has its own jetty so we caught a water taxi to the airport (about $100) which was very nice.the rooms were quiet,clean ,and comfortable.We had use of free wi fi and computer.The breakfast was good and we reserved a table on the verandah so we could watch the gondolas go by.I would recommend this hotel highly

Reviews.Title: “We are already planning our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: The_Welkers
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel Becher on our honeymoon. The hotel is located very close to S. Marco and other major sites. Our room had a view of the canal that ran beside the hotel. The room was well appointed and comfortable. What really made our stay special was the amazing staff. They did everything they could to make our stay memorable including arranging for a special gondola to pick us up at the back of the hotel, rose petals on our bed, excellent restaurant recommendations and walking tours. The star was the hotel manager Anna who helped us to plan our time in Venice and gave us lots of excellent suggestions about restaurants and sites. We will definitely be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best!”
Reviews.Author: CarTBar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our first trip to Venice. Completed a 12 day cruise with a couple of days at this hotel. Absolutely the best location for first timers. Staff is the most helpful and courteous of any we have encountered in our extensive travels. We do not usually stay at the smaller inn like hotels, but we may rethink that in the future. Location and staff are certainly the strengths of this hotel. We felt welcomed and before we left we felt like family. From restaurant recommendations to airport departure details, the front desk was helpful in every regard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location small hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: Anotherinnerwestie
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently in their junior suite for a splurge. The only thing I could fault is the gondolier traffic jams outside the window in the middle of the day (complete with soundtrack). Early morning and late afternoon/evening when the day trippers have gone is fabulous. The room was huge and had a Venetian mini balcony - you can just squeeze a chair on it (2 if you use the other doors) There are great shops just outside the back door too. We found necklaces in paolo's shop (ask Anna which one) there by one of the known (branded) murano factories at almost 1/3 of the prices we were told in other shops. We did not find anything cheaper (for the quality) anywhere else in Venice. They also had listed prices so you knew where you stood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, no need to go anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: mstisi
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an experience!!! This hotel was close enough and far enough from everything. The staff were just amazing and the service was over the top. The rooms were spotless and the breakfast just right. The warm greetings to the help offered from where to go, how to buy a sim card for for our phone, to arranging a private water taxi. All done with ease and a smile. Very humble staff that made us all feel special. A truly wonderful experience made possible by amazing people. Many thanks Ana and all the incredible staff at the Hotel Becher. You all have the right mix!!! Can't wait to go back!!! Hope to see you soon!!! Mike & Renata

Reviews.Title: “She felt like princess :)”
Reviews.Author: lovelydays_26
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in heart of Venice, close to Marco polo Room was amazing and beautifully decorated. It makes you feel special. Can sit in front of lobby and wave to all Gondola's passing by. Lovely setup Helpful staff. Nice breakfast Bit pricey but its worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “This must be the best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Frandis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher is perfect, great location only 5 mins walk to San Marco, very good value for money, staff who can't do enough for you, beautiful rooms in typical venetian style, hotel has its own water landing stage, surrounded by lovely restaurants and shops, quiet location, rooms overlooking the canal, spotlessly clean, exceptionally well cared for, very good breakfast, what more can I say? Book this hotel you will not be dissappointed a true hidden gem of venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming hotel, delightful staff!”
Reviews.Author: eversogreene
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the moment we departed, we cannot say enough about the graciousness of the staff - simply wonderful. Anna was kind enough to provide us with a complimentary bottle of Prosecco to enjoy on their hotel jetty with our friends one evening - such a lovely touch. Our room was beautiful - we stayed in the Junior Suite with a balcony overlooking the canal. We loved watching (and waving to) the gondoliers and their passengers as they rode past our balcony. Great location with easy access to just about anything you want to see or do in Venice. All in all, simply an echanting time in a charming hotel with a warm, accommodating staff. Thank you, Anna, Kaes, Massimiliano and Tanya for a truly memorable stay. We hope to return soon! Best regards, Linda & Frank, Fairfield, CT

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: poebee
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel for a weekend trip to Venice. The location could not have been better. Since we arrived shortly before Midnight at Marco Polo we decided to take a water taxi for the transfer which can land directly at the hotel's mini jetty on the San Luca Canal. Although horribly expensive, it was worth the deal. The hotel itself is very well run with a very friendly staff. We had booked a superior room with canal view which was a real treat. We enjoyed watching and hearing the Gondalas go by. All round a great little hotel and our first choice for our next stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic week in venice”
Reviews.Author: sparkywagner1
Reviews.Content: From start to finish it was great. From arriving to departing, Venice is a dream. The Hotel Becher made it that much more special. Massimiliano and crew made it just a little better. From walking around, to checking out the sites, around every corner something special would be found. It was nice to become one of the "locals" by not jumping around from one city to another. The restaurants, shops, street vendors, Gelato stands and history were just breathtaking. What a city to see.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed in Italy”
Reviews.Author: buck8444
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in Hotel Becher Venice. Booked ontripadvisor reviews. Amazing hotel right on the canal in a good area of venice. Everyone leaving was vowing to come back. Tey foubd out it was my wifes birthday and treated her amazing. Highly recommended and thanks to the previous reviewers who got it so right

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venice!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sophia90
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived at the hotel, we were treated so wonderfully. Ms. Anna and all the staff were extremely helpful and courteous the entire time we were there. They went out of their way to make things PERFECT for us. The rooms were extremely clean and good size for Europe. We had requested a canal view and they provided that for us. It was amazing. The food at the buffet was very good and the cappacinos were a nice treat. The location was fantastic! So close to St. Mark's Square,and the Accademia. All in all, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice. You will not be disappointed. I do not have anything negative to say at all! Just go and enjoy as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aidenbaz
Reviews.Content: A Fantastic hotel! The dock for boats on the waterway was exactly what I am looking for and also wonderful place for a cup of cappuccino in the morning. The staff was very welcoming, friendly and proficient. Really this place deserves to be four stars. My room was beautiful, very comfortable and looked out on one of the canals. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: DC_girlinLondon
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of bad reviews about other hotels in Venice, we decided to splurge, and it was totally worth it. The hotel was very quiet, clean, and looks exactly like the pictures on the website. The room was large, the bathroom was clean and also large, the bed was comfortable. The staff were very kind and helpful, and the breakfast was great. Other than the cost (and the crappy hairdryer) I have nothing to complain about it!

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in a location ideal for the traveller.”
Reviews.Author: Cascol7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is exactly as the reviews desribe. We had warm welcome from the manager and staff with nothing too much trouble. So helpful and attentive to all your needs. I have no hesitation in endorsing all the good points that the previous reviews express. It's in an excellent position and ideal position for sightseeing and eating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great location, excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: donnelbr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. We arrived late on the first night (10pm) and the night porter was there to great us, check us in, walk us to our room and get us settled as quickly as possible. The staff were very attentive, all speak English and were very friendly. The room was an average size European hotel room. It was very tidy and comfortable. The hotel has free wifi and internet access via a internet cafe on the second floor. Breakfast is included with your stay and consisted of juice/coffee, breads, muffins, fruit, cereals, pastries, etc. The hotel also has its own dock on the canal where you can get picked up or dropped of by water taxi - very convenient. The hotel is located within 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge and close by to some good restaurants. Massimiliano was extremely helpful. No complaints. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have hoped for during our time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: wisewanderer565
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher was a beautiful and well-run hotel in the heart of Venice. The location couldn't have been better, only a five minute walk to St. Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge (as long as you know where you're going :-) The staff were exceptional! Massimiliano was extremely helpful with information on where to go, what to eat, how to navigate the city, coordinate bookings and so much more. Took a lot of the stress out of travel. Women, be sure to bring your own hairdryer as the ones in the room are older and take forever to use. And the pillows were a bit flat for our taste, yet that's just us. Overall, a fantastic experience and we would definitely stay again in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL BECHER - A REAL TREASURE!”
Reviews.Author: JMSCRIV
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at the Becher for my husbands 40th Birthday surprise. I have to say that it was a real treat. Just trying to find it down all the little back streets and over little bridges was exciting! The owners and staff their could not have been more welcoming. It's small, or should I say compact, but it's location is perfect for all the main attractions. I have to say I booked a superior room and was at first disappointed in the size of the room but got over that pretty quickley. The rooms are very clean, the sheets immaculate. Look out for the gondola seranades! you have to hang out of the window to watch the gondolas go by with the singer/accordian player belting out traditional itialian numbers! Just fab! Breakfast is very basic but has what you need. I ordered a bottle of sparkling wine to be in our room on arrival - they brought to the room once we had arrived but I couldn't complain as the tray was filled with lots of little snack to accompany it - olives, pistachio nuts, crisps, salsa dip...just a nice little touch. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, a hotel to use for sleep and breakfast in Venice”
Reviews.Author: paolos74
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Becher with my wife. We arrived at Marco Polo and pre-booked a water taxi at www.motoscafivenezia.it for the transfer to the hotel , yes the cost of 100 Euro is extravagant but well worth it for the views, sense of occasion and the convenience of landing right at the the hotel's mini jetty on the San Luca Canal. We had a room looking over the canal which was a good size with a decent sized bathroom - you have to allow for the fact that space in Venice is at a premium. We had two windows overlooking the canal with frequent gondoliers and water taxis passing by. The room had air con though not needed when we were there in early March. The hotel is 1 minute from La Fenice, 5 minutes from St Marks Square and 10 mins to Rialto or Accademia so is very conveniently placed. Breakfast was typical Italian city small hotel however the room is very cramped and if too many people arrive at the same time it can be a bit of a squeeze. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull. One minor complaint was the lack of info in the room regarding the safe, mini bar and tv - I am being very picky here though. Overall I was very happy with my choice and will definitely go back to to the Becher next time I visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: FA99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my 2 young kids. Travelled with friends who also had 2 young children. It's the first 3-Star I've ever stayed in and well... it was very good in general. Firstly, the main staff is a family of three (they don't own the hotel just work there) father, mother & Son. The Son speaks 7 languages and the mother is simply wonderful. Very warm & friendly. The hotel is very well located and close to San Marco Square. It's quaint and the rooms are clean. If you're a bath person be sure to ask for the room with a normal bath otherwise (like me) you'll get a half bath which is very uncomfortable. Also if you like your hair take a hairdryer as they have those silly things on the wall that take ages to dry. Breakfast is fresh and plenty to go around (continental only). Very reasonably priced. All in all I fully reccomend this hotel and I own my own hotel in Luton and so I know what to look for. My only complaint the pillows are not comfortable. Buy hey, you're in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL WITH WONDERFUL ENGAGING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Bam02010
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. The room was spacious and beautiful and the staff were just the most pleasant and accommodating! They were so friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Location was perfect - close to everything and breakfast was delightful! We will certainly stay here again if we ever make it back to Venice! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: gc1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in November, and we had a great experience with this hotel. Nestled by a small canal, it's in a great location - a five minute walk to St Marks square - without being overrun by foot traffic. The staff were great: after the first night when the room wasn't quite to our liking, Anna - the wonderful manager in charge - immediately moved us to a better room, and arranged for a complimentary bottle of prosecco for us when she discovered that our trip for was for my girlfriend's birthday. It all helped to make our trip to Venice very enjoyable. Greg and Uri

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Service"”
Reviews.Author: Kensington1899
Reviews.Content: A great hotel! Four star customer service for three star prices. The breakfast is hearty, the decor classic Venetian. The dock for boats on the waterway was just what we were looking for and a perfect place for a cup of espresso in the morning. The staff were welcoming and top-notch all the way! Probably the only thing keeping this from being a 4 star place is a lack of non-Italian cable channels. But hey, you're in Venice! You can watch the BBC when you get home. We had a little trouble keeping warm in the room but that was probably just our own ineptitude with the controls. A great find near San Marco!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: carolienoey
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in this lovely hotel. The owners and all staff made us feel very welcome. Our room was beautiful, very comfortable and looked out on one of the canals. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet & charming hotel , great hospitality of Anna and her husband.”
Reviews.Author: Gili1959
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher Venice near St. Mark's Square (Piazza San Marco ) ) Sweet, tidy neat and comfort hotel. 5 min' from St Marco square and about the same min' walk from Rialto bridge. Wonderful couple run the Becher Hotel . Anna and her husband, with grace , personal charm and warmth hospitality. So Great ! evrything about the hotel faced our needs and met with our expectations . breackfast, class of hotel designe and dÃ©cor and clean , so tiny hotel and so amazingly spacious . Pay attention to the Water-Texi if you come 1st time to venice . there are several taxis that comes close to St Mark's square But the No' 2 ( for instance) goes and takes about 45 Min' from the train station Santa Lucia ( it circles Venice ) and there is another No' 2 which goes straight through the Grand Canal to the station , has only a few stops on the way and makes the journey in - half the timeâ€¦ And do yourselves a favour â€“ DONâ€™T sit in St Mark's square and pay 40 eu for 2 sandwiches and 2 coffee , what a RIP-OFF !! what a typically tourist's trap that we fell intoâ€¦ ( the Bar placed- is when you stand with your back to the sea and the boats, and you face St Mark's square, itâ€™s the 1st Bar on the left â€“ itâ€™s a corner Bar right at the beginning of the square )..Beware .

Reviews.Title: “Easily one of the Best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: InnatSunsetCliffs
Reviews.Content: First off, I manage a hotel. I know how things go in the hotel industry. Hotel Becher is a top hotel in venice. With their modern and old fashion design, they make a great mix with each other. The rooms are old fashion(furniture, table,etc) but the rooms have technology. Energy saving products, lights turn off when you exit the room, the bathrooms are modern. Staff goes out of their way for guest. We got back late one night and the front desk let us sit out on their dock that is on the canal and drink wine the rest of the night!!! Was a memorable experience. Thank you! The manager, didn't catch her name, is awesome. Totally cares about her place and wants everyone to enjoy their experience with them. I had no trouble with the language either. Everyone speaks english. This is very helpful when trying to leave Venice. Easy to get lost...Hotel is in prime location. Everything is close. Food in the area is excellent. You have to eat somewhere on the canals. It's a must. One issue though, was the bathroom smell. Smelt like eggs when you woke up after the evening. Staff took care of it immediately every time it happened. The manager gave us a generous discount upon check in. no hassle at all. But did have to deal with it. Last issue was the A/C wasn't working fully and we kept the windows open. This was a huge mistake due to the over population of mosquitos in Italy. Had to wake up in the middle of the night and go ninja on the mosquitos that just feasted on me. Not cool. Overall we had a great time and would return. The breakfast in great for Europe. The service is impressive and the design is modern. Would return!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: d00d33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Nov2010 and couldn't have been happier. This hotel has a great central location in Venice to allow walking to most areas. The rooms are very nice and well decorated. We were most impressed with the warmth of the staff and quality of the customer service. Very friendly, accommodating, and engaging. Definitely would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you wont regret it”
Reviews.Author: BillyandNic
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic little place. We loved staying here. Venice was our final stop in Italy and we couldn't have picked a better city or a better hotel to end our travels. This hotel is small and quaint, in a good location and a good price for Venice. The rooms are nicely decorated and have everything you need (safe, mini bar, free wifi etc). Our room was small but we were advised of this on check-in and offered a choice (small room with canal view or large room without one) and we choose the room for the view which was lovely. The breakfast was good - not too much choice but great quality for what they did have - the chocolate croissants were fabulous and the ham was the best we had tasted in Italy. Nice coffee too. What makes this place special is the staff who are so friendly and so willing to help in any way they can, that you feel like you are a special member of the family or a VIP! For example - we asked if we could take a bottle of wine and sit on the jetty/boat dock thingy one evening - Daniel on reception said this was fine and we were happy just to sit at the table as it was. However he decided he would make it more romantic for us by getting a table cloth, huge proper wine glasses and some lanterns and opening and pouring the wine for us and offering to take a photo for us. Nice touch. He also refused the tip we willingly offered. The next day we asked the lady at reception if they had a book exchange there - they don't (which isn't unusual) but she called the other hotel owned by the same people to see if they had any (they did) and then walked in the rain down to that hotel to get the books that they had available for us to choose from. If you're looking for a great experience in Venice, stay here - you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: bridget1000
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the Hotel Becher in Venice and all thought it was a good choice. We had visited Venice before but my sister, who travelled with us, had not. We were given a warm welcome at the Becher and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous throughout our stay. The breakfast was good and my sister and I thoroughly enjoyed the fresh fruit salad every day. Our room looked out over the canal and we enjoyed watching the gondolas meandering by. The hotel was quiet even though it was in the middle of the city and it is ideally located for all the main attractions. Considering how expensive Venice is, we thought this hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, wonderful hosts, quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: dm49
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher sits right along the path that the gondoliers take with their passengers. They have a wonderful little dock with two bistro tables. Pick up a lunch to go and a bottle of wine and sit on their little dock and have lunch and enjoy the traffic passing by - the gondola riders are as pleased to see this little spot as we were to see them enjoying their ride (and we got to enjoy the music they brought along for free). We were treated so well. Anna (reception desk) is a wonderful hostess. The room was very nice, the breakfast nice, and the location to everything was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Very kind and warm staff who look after you, excellent location, & very cosy venetian rooms.”
Reviews.Author: maureen003
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for a couple of nights in October. The owners were so friendly and really went out of their way to advise and look after us. The hotel has a fab location and most importantly is easy to navigate back to after a night out (very important in venice!). The rooms are very tastefully decorated and its quiet at night which allows for a good sleep. The chocolate croissants in the morning are the best ive tasted, EVER! I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in San Marco and great service from hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: klspac
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I were in Venice for 2 nights during the first week of October 2010. Since I work in the travel industry, I did quite a bit of research on which hotel would be the best overall option (incl. actual accommodations/rooms, service, amenities and location). I chose Hotel Becher primarily for its great location near St. Mark's Square/Basilica and the famous Rialto Bridge. Although there was one or two other hotels which also interested us, we were limited by the fact that we were booking the room only one week prior to leaving for Europe. Hotel Becher has a great location, we even found it in the dark of the Venice streets, and is near all the known "Venice highlights" that were on our list to see. It is located right on one of the minor canals and has its own entrance from the canal, in case you decide to spring for a gondola to drop you off. We chose to take the vaporetto from the train station to the San Marco vaporetto stop and then hoof it from there to the hotel. In general it was easy to find, once you realize that the entire city of Venice is a labyrinth of corridors. It was great that there were no stairs at the hotel entrance - a benefit when you're lugging around your luggage. Interior of hotel's common areas was very classy and classic Venetian style. Breakfast area is small, however, everything in Venice is small, and the food was plentiful and tasty. Our room was one of the classic Venetian decorated rooms with a view from its own private balcony overlooking the canal - - Awesome!! Although small in size (only a double bed placed into the corner of room), it was clean and modern and the bathroom was sparkling clean. The hotel staff were fantastic at guiding you to the right restaurant, the best local bakery/coffee, and even your best option to getting to the airport on the morning we left. No complaints of Hotel Becher at all. Beyond adequate,comfortable and affordable, earning its 4 star status. Definately offers alot of bang for your buck. Stay there if you want to experience Venice in its classic ways, and if you want to be in the midst of the Venice's "must-see highlights."

Reviews.Title: “Very child friendly”
Reviews.Author: RebLong
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for our family (2) young children and grandma, the hotel were so accommodating. The staff were always willing to help and the location is perfect!! The breakfast was adequate but the free flowing cappucinos / hot chocolates were sensational. The hotel also has a pier which means the airport taxis can take you straight to the door!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and super staff”
Reviews.Author: KateHr
Reviews.Content: Romantic rooms and very nice staff. we came there during Carnival and asked if we could use balconey to sip Champagne while dressed up for the occasion. no problem for the staff who was very careful. Breakfast room a bit small but nothing dramatic. have already recommended to friends and will for sure come back next time in Venezia Thank you for this wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good service - would come back!”
Reviews.Author: Another_US_Expat
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on value and trip advisor reviews - and we were not disappointed. The location is close to San Marco yet quiet. The service was good, staff were helpful and welcoming. All in all - a good experience. The hotel is little pricey - but so is all of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and setting”
Reviews.Author: cea60
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice, went to this hotel, the staff were very friendly and the hotel in a great position right beside a little canal, with Gondola's passing by. my room was a little small but very clean and well furnished,As for Venice itself it was very busy but saw most of the sights, when I go back again I would have no hesitation choosing this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location & clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: bclouds
Reviews.Content: We are from Asian country and we did alot of reading before we book the hotel in Venice as there were so many hotels.. We are very glad we stayed at Hotel Becher. First of all I like to comment the cleanliness of the hotel room. The room and bathroom are well kept. The breakfast was simple and nice. The staff was friendly and provided alot of imformation of touring venice. The the location is great as is near to San Mark Square! We highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: BubbleBandit
Reviews.Content: Icannot emphasize what a pleasure it was to stay at this hotel!The rooms are lovely, the staff friendly and the location the best! I would recommend it to friends, couples, business travellers etc. I don't think it would be suitable for families though, as it is a boutique hotel and quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: john_porter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in the Becher Hotel durng early September 2010. The hotel is ideally situated between Teatro La Fenice and Piazza San Marco. We stayed in a Junior Suite overlooking a small canal which was smaller than we expected but the room was clean and the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was simple continental style which was adequate but could have done with a little more variety on a daily basis. Our only negatives would be the internet connection which had to be renewed every day and the fact that the small room safe had a mind of its own and frequently opened itself! We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: ollwain
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for three nights in August and had a great experience. The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful, providing wifi, printing out bus timetables etc etc. The room was a bit small and dark, as it was on the ground floor, but faced the canal and was very comfortable. There is also a lovely little canal side table on the communal terrace, perfect for working at.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience once again!”
Reviews.Author: MeeFamily04
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hoter Becher and the experience just seems to get better. My daughter and I were there 2 years ago and when we found ourselves back in Venice with the whole family, we had no hesitation staying there again. It is such a beautiful hotel, perfectly situated and the staff are there for you at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Charming and incredibly quaint hotel with superb service”
Reviews.Author: italianprincess_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and children 9 and 11 stayed at Hotel Becher and it is truly a hidden gem among many stones. The ambiance of the hotel is superb with a great deal of attention to style and decor. For a true Venetian experience you must stay at this hotle. The rooms are very reminescent of venetian times and extremely clean. The rooms are smalle but more than adequate with all you need. Our room faced the canal with a balcony. It was so much fun to see the gondola's pass an hear them sing and play the accordian. It is truly music to our ears. Upon our arrival Anna and her husand Paolo greeted us with such warmth and attention. They were extremely helpful in every way possible. Maps were provided to us with all the highlights to see in Vencie. Dining in Venice is incredible. Anna had made reservations for us both nights and we were not disappointed. The piazza right outside the hotel beside the opera house has the best food and very authentic. You must try the Spaghetti a la caprese. The breakfast includes, cured meats, cheeses, an assortment of fruits, yogurts, croissants and bread with cereal and milk. If after a long day or evening the staff will even make you an espresso if you ask. There is nothing that Anna and her staff will not do for you. The hotel itself is in a great area. There is so much shopping and places to see. If you want to catch a gondola ride try to get one between 12:00 and 2:00 it was much cheaper. We only paid 80 euros. Don't tak a gondola near the main square it is considerably more expensive. The hotel will send you to the murano glass factory for free and you will have to make your way back by water taxi. It is nice to see Venice by the water on route to the factory, however not worth seeing if you have to pay. The factory itself we found to be expensive, save your money and buy something outside it was much cheaper. When we return to Venice we will definately stay at the Hotel Becher. This was one of the highlights of our month touring Italy. The memories will last forever.

Reviews.Title: “loved Venezia despite the storms and flooding!”
Reviews.Author: thesmiledoc
Reviews.Content: Convenient hotel on a side canal, good value for our family and the lovely lady as the receptionist was very warm, friendly, and professional! Most fun was a water taxi pick up by Matteo in a pristine mahogany boat on the morining of our departure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Amazing stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CaroNader
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights from 13.-15.6. at Hotel Becher before moving further to Rome. We arrived by plane and took the Ali Laguna Water Taxi which was per person/way EUR 13, it took us about half an hour to get to St. Market Square and from there another 7 minutes to walk (print location map from www.hotelbecher.com). Even though the walk was not that long, there are 2 or 3 bridges to cross, with luggage not too easy but in my opinion better than to pay EUR 100 for a private water taxi. The hotel is not too big, rooms small but with Canal View and just sooo romantic. You can reach all the important places in Venice easily by foot, there are a lot of shops/restaurants near by, do a Gondola Trip but be careful, they want to charge up to EUR 150 per hour, we found a great guy who we payed EUR 80, so don't go with the first best. All in all, amazing stay in Venice, great and romantic city!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE IN ALL OF ITALY”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1221
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just traveled throughout Italy for the past two weeks and we stayed in nothing but four and five star hotels. Out of all the places that we stayed this hotel was the loveliest. Anna Maria and Paolo are the most gracious hosts that we have ever encountered in our traveling around the world. Their willingness to accommodate our every request was amazing and their restaurant recommendations were absolutely phenomenal. If you ever go to Venice, for that matter anywhere in Italy, you MUST visit the Hotel Becher - you will not regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel in San Marco with private boat/gondola dock. Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: usukus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Becher for a three day weekend in June away from the children. We had an amazing trip! This hotel was one of the best parts of our stay. A very small hotel with absolutely delightful owners, spotless rooms, it's own private boat dock, in the heart of San Marco and extremely quiet! We were upgraded to a canal view without any extra charge, as we were celebrating my birthday and our anniversary. This was a very unique experience listening to the gondolier's paddling by. There is a small amount of noise with this, but we enjoyed it very much. The boats do not go through the night, so it was silent by the time we got back from dinner. Great restaurants nearby, a free boat ride to Murano, it was worth the money to take a private boat to the airport. A wonderful, memorable vacation! We will be going back and staying at the same place!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: OneTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Becher is a lovely, central-located hotel with a friendly, helpful staff. The room was freshly decorated in Venetian brocades and was large by European standards. The bed was comfortable, and the continental breakfast, while not large, was a good start to the day. There was also an elevator and the complimentary use of an Internet-connected computer. A big plus was the boat dock where water taxis could pick you up or deliver you. All in all, a very nice place to stay in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, comfortable and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vegplot15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for a week and found this hotel to be in the perfect spot to walk to St Mark's Sq, the Academia and the Rialto - as all were equi-distant apart. Also located near the theatre, so evening of entertainment is on your door step. The hotel has friendly and informative staff, the rooms are very good, we were upgraded to a Deluxe Room from a Superior Room due to some electrical fault, therefore can only comment on this style of more luxurious room was fab and very spacious, well decorated and clean. Beds were a little firm - as seems to be the case all over Italy. The breakfast was very good a range of cereals, breads, yoghurts, cheeses, hams, biscuits/crackers, fruits, fruit juices and delicious croissants!! As you leisurely eat your breakfast, you can gaze at the canal traffic which passes by the rear of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but you might find a better place”
Reviews.Author: mkfore244
Reviews.Content: When we compare this hotel to the others we stayed at in Italy it comes in last, but it was also the least expensive. We spent two weeks in Italy and our least favorite hotel was this one. It was centrally located, but really anywhere in Venice is centrally located. DON'T fall in to the trap of thinking location is the most important thing when staying in Venice. This hotel is near San Marco, but it only took us 20 minutes to walk to a good restaurant on the far east of the island. When the front desk found out it was our honeymoon, they asked if we wanted to move to a canal side view, which we choose to do, which was very nice of them. The Breakfast's were good with croissant's, meat, cheese, cappuccino, etc. The rooms were small (We know they are all small in Italy) or at least we thought that until we went to Florence. They try to go for the Venetian style of furniture, but it resulted in a rather cheap feel to the room. Our bed was two twin beds pushed together, with the fitted sheet as the only thing holding them together.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Glenn08
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I traveled with our 2 sons aged 12 and 10. There were so many hotels and reviews regarding Venice but a lot of consistent ones about this hotel. It is not 5 star, but very clean and the owners are very friendly and helpful. Our room had a double bed, single and a rollaway so it was tight however the position was perfect. Our room overlooked a canal and it was fun for the boys to see the gondalas going past. The breakfast room is very small but we never had to wait. We arrived by train and took a water taxi which was a good move as we were unfamiliar with Venice. On departure, we took public transport back to the station. Close to the main square and lots of restaurants around. Don't miss Rosa Rossa!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, convenient location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: iltrav5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly close to San Marco with easy access from the vaporetto stop. Hotel lobby was small but charming. A party of 3 adults and 3 young teenagers, we had two rooms, one overlooking a courtyard, the other overlooking the canal. Rooms were ample in size, clean, traditional but relatively new decor, plenty of hot water and good pressure in updated large bathrooms, heating was fine. Very comfortable beds. Breakfast was served on the second level in a lovely room overlooking the canal, where you could watch the gondolas and other boats go by. Breakfast was good- a variety of breads, meat, cheese, yogurt, cereal, juice, coffee/tea- and plentiful. We were there over Christmas, and despite the hassles of dealing with a record high water on Christmas Eve, staff were friendly and helpful. Anna worked with us via email before we arrived, helping us to make reservations at restaurants that would be open on the holidays. They held our luggage after checkout so we could take a water taxi to Murano. When we returned, they called ahead to our hotel in Rome to let them know of our late arrival. The hotel was a lovely place to stay, but the real charm was in the hospitality of the staff. It helped create a wonderful impression of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loveliest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: dendo2
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! The hotel is a gem made our stay for two nights in Venice totally wonderful experience. -Extremely clean rooms -Extensive re-creation of charming residence type of small hotel -Extremely friendly and helpful staff who can speak fluent English -Reasonable pricing -Fantastic location We could not think of any negatives. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsMM9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights in June. It was a nice little hotel with such a friendly staff. We enjoyed a great bottle of wine that was from the region where the owner is from, one of our favorites through out the trip. Great little breakfast in the morning. Really nice location. If we ever make it back we will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: kate264
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TRIPADVISOR I chose this hotel. The location is excellent, the price is very good for this location and the quality of service! I booked the regular room and I asked for 2 beds for me and my daughter - and we got it! The room was not big, but comfortable enough for 2 ( booking the regular hotel room in the heart of the old european city you should not expect to stay there with the family of 4). We liked the canal view and gondoliers - this is Venezia! The staff is very friendly and we liked the breakfast! And I can tell you - I've been in many tourist sites throughout Europe - this is an amazing hotel for the amazing price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: manjun
Reviews.Content: It was a two day pleasure and two day work tour to Venice. The work related meeting were on the mainland, but we decided to stay on the island. The island though a lot more expensive than the mainland is a wonderful experience. Hotel Becher has an excellent location - though it took us some time to find it for the first time. St. Mark's square, Rialto Bridge everything is very easily accessible. To travel to the other island's Murano, Burano etc the water taxi stop is also nearby. We bought a 5 day pass and used it for all our island hopping. The only time we had to pay was when we took the Ali Laguna line to and from the airport. The other great thing about Becher is their extremely friendly and helpful staff. The helped us with everything in the hotel and also recommended us to nice experiences around the hotel. Overall it was a great experience in Venice, a good reason for that being Hotel Becher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: travelermd09
Reviews.Content: My wife, her sister, husband and I spent a few days at the Hotel Becher in September. We took a water taxi from the airport direct to the Hotel. This is memory not to be missed. The Hotel is clean, has a great location and owners who will go out of their way to be of help. Anna was the best. She gave us directions to two local restaurants and it was a wonderful experience. Just finding our way to and from the hotel was an adventure we all enjoyed. Venice is awesome and the Hotel Becher is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for a room with no air conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: angandtone
