Reviews.Content: This hotel listed amenities: air-conditioning and ceiling fan and had neither. We arrived after 11pm and the room was very hot our first night so I complained to the front desk the next day who blamed it on the window not being closed properly and promised it would be fixed that day. That same night it was still hot. When I complained the next day I was told they thought it was fixed so the call to the technician had been cancelled! They again promised it would be fixed. When we got back to the room later that day it was still so hot it was uncomfortable. I was told the air could not be fixed so we were moved to another room. It was mentioned that it was sometimes cold on the floor so air conditioning would be shut off entirely! The second room was also hot, but a little better than the first room. By the following morning, it was uncomfortably hot again. I asked the front desk if there could be any discount given since we paid for a room that promised air conditioning. I was told no, that no discount or reduction of the rate could be given! When promised (and paying) for a room with air conditioning and an establishment does not deliver on that, there should be a discount in the rate. I could have booked a room at another hotel with no air conditioning and saved some money. There was not even a ceiling fan which was also advertised on the web site. I found it odd that in 2 different rooms there was no ceiling fan and no air conditioning. If you are staying in Venice and the average temperature is 75 degrees or higher (as it was during our stay) and air conditioning is important to you when booking a room (not to mention the importance of getting what you paid for!) then this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!!! Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: qweenma
Reviews.Content: By far I made the right choice with Hotel Becher during my stay in Venice. The accomodations were pristine. Excellent and friendly staff. Continental breakfast that was more than most European hotels. The location is super!! A few minute walk to San Marco Square and a few minutes to Rialto Bridge. You couldnt ask for a better location. Clean, large bath I give this a 4 star!!! You will not regret booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: JohnNeath
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and some friends in September. Beautiful place, wonderful, helpful staff. large room with comfy bed. perfect location. will recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TexasDrb
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel with excellant staff! Large room and bath. Good breakfast. Anna and Paulie were very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations--Rosa Rosa and Al Giglio. Must take a gondola ride!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: mustbnearc
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at Hotel Becher, they had, at no additional charge, upgraded me to a canal facing room, where I was at eye level with the gondoleers. Rooms were very clean. The service was great. I wanted more than the normal tourist experince -- that included eating and drinking more of what the local's do. Their recommendations were excellent. The location is convenient, with just a short walk to St. Mark's Square, and the Rialto Bridge. As a side note, I had friends tell me I might get bored spending more than 3 days in Venice. I can safely say, I'd easily spend a week there, so many nooks to explore. And if you like photograpy, just a great place. One other side note. As with many other hotels, calling toll free numbers actually costs money. I asked ahead of time. I had taken my iPhone with me and wanted to avoid spending much when I called back to the states. I ended up spending hours on the phone for about $10. One word: SKYPE . I used it on my iPhone over their free wireless access.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet â€“ simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ruhe
Reviews.Content: Terrific concierge service. They went out of their way to give us a room when we arrived early and gave excellent restaurant recommendations. For an extremely quite room, request a room on the interior instead of on the canal. You'll see more canals than you can image during the day. Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - booked on recomendations from tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: flyanddive
Reviews.Content: The perfect location, within easy walking distance to Rialto Bridge and St. Marks square. Anywhere in the city is accessible by water taxi. We arrived in Venice on what many locals said was the worst they ever seen it rain. That's why the ability to arrive at the hotel by water taxi is worth every euro. You could not ask more of the staff, (Eleonora and Anna) went out of their way to make the best of poor weather conditions and provided excellent travel advice. Follow their recommendations on restaurants and you will please with a very good meal at a reasonable price. Not all was lost; the next two days were perfect. If you have time use the public water buses to visit the outer islands. I will go to Venice and I will stay at this hotel again. We consistently watch tourist take photos of the hotel, the gondolas float by your window, and I could go on forever about the quality of our stay. We used the internet to book our trip, and you can email questions to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: francettravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is beautifully presented with wonderful staff. We arrived in Venice when it was raining, absolutely pouring, and we had to wade through flooded streets (so ourselves and our bags were completely soaked). The Hotel Becher staff were so accommodating to our situation and welcomed us to the hotel it made our unpleasant arrival bearable. The hotel room was wonderful with a chandler and the decor was elegant italian furnishing. Our room was a little small so we would definitely recommend spending a little extra to get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful. Nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: TimAnne
Reviews.Content: First time in Venice and I took my partner there as a surprise for her 50th birthday. I spent a lot of time on Trip Advisor trying to find the right hotel. I realised immediately that Venice is an expensive place across the board and so wanted to make sure I spent what little money I had wisely and to get good value. I booked direct with the hotel and their communication by email was excellent. Unfortunately Hotel Becher could not accommodate us for the whole 3 days, but said they could put us in one of their other hotels for the last night. This was the **** AD Place Hotel, which was a short distance away. We only ended up staying at Hotel Becher for the 1st night and they moved us the next day with the manager from AD Place meeting us to help us with our bags. All of the staff are warm and friendly and very willing to help. The rooms were lovely, with a nice Venetian style decor. Breakfast was OK and although I have seen on other reports that the breakfast area is small, this is not really a negative and it is also possible to eat on a small landing area which juts out into the canal. The hotel also has an elevator. They also organise a complementary trip to the Island of Murano to visit a glass factory. This was just brilliant and I highly recommend it. You book it the day before and then are picked up from the hotel by private water taxi. This was a great experience as the journey takes you right through the centre of Venice using some of the smaller canals before coming out the other side and experiencing a high speed ride past the cemetery. On arrival we were met by an English speaking guide who was most knowledgeable about the glass making and the products they make. The tour then ends and you can either get a vaporetto back to Venice or continue (as we did) to explore the island and its many shops. All in all very impressed. I will write a further report on the Hotel AD Place.

Reviews.Title: “So romantic....”
Reviews.Author: maria0211
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this wonderful hotel with my husband this September. Imagine it was our first trip, just him and me, after three years doing every single trip with our three year old daughter.. Which is nice, but different-). Sp, we really carried about this journey to be something romantic and special.. And it was! The hotel is a family small â€˜boutiqueâ€™ hotel in the very city center but in the quiet location. We were happy to get upgraded to the junior suite which has a nice balcony overlooking a canal with gondolas passing downstairs and a view on a beautiful small bridge. The room was also exceptional, beautifully decorated and had a good size.. The hotelâ€™s staff was always very nice, smiling and ready to help you. Overall, itâ€™s more a four star hotel then a three star.. We are already planning to go back next year..-))

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous experience at Hotel Becher in Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: CatInLouKy
Reviews.Content: Anna, the hotel manager was most pleasant and accommodating. We had read somewhere, perhaps on TripAdvisor, that Hotel Becher is a three-star hotel, striving to be a four-star hotel. We were not disappointed in any way. Anna was very helpful, spoke good English and we could tell that service and guest satisfaction were her top priority. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and could only stay one night in Venice. When we go back we will definitely stay at Hotel Becher. It is in the heart of Venice. The room was fabulous and we had our own balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it every time”
Reviews.Author: Passporttonowhere
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher is one of the most expensive three-star hotels in Venice. This is because it is, emphatically, worth every penny. The hotel is conveniently located for all the sights of the city, staffed by warm, friendly and approachable staff who are happy to talk and share their knowledge of the city with you without being in any way pushy or talking to you when you'd rather be left to your own devices. My fairer half and I enjoyed a two night stay here, but would have loved to have stayed for longer, it is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in of any price range. Achingly romantic with decor that only a venetian hotel can really get away with, anyone planning a short break to the city for two should stay here. We were upgraded to a junior suite on arrival, and the room was very large, and the bed massively comfortable, slept like a log throughout. It was a wonderful base for sightseeing and a haven to relax when tired, gondoliers paddling along the canal outside and serenading tourists. You don't go to Venice unless you're prepared to accept a few cliches... Stay here. You won't regret it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, friendly and helpful staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Simaynard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days of our honeymoon at Hotel Becher in August 2009. We had booked a room and requested a canal view. On arrival we were unexpectedly upgraded to a suite with a balcony, a lovely gesture which really set the tone for the rest of our stay. The hotel's location is ideal for wandering around the major attractions in venice. A very short walk from Saint Mark's square and the vaparetto stop, and an equally short distance to the Accademia bridge over the grand canal. The staff were all warm, friendly, welcoming and extremely helpful and assisted us with booking tickets for a Vivaldi concert at the Chiesa di San Vidal. Another surprise treat was the complimentary water taxi to Murano island laid on by the hotel, and a free tour of a glass factory. Murano is a beautiful island and we thoroughly enjoyed wandering round the glass shops and found a great restaurant for lunch. In summary, Hotel Becher is a fantastic base for a holiday in Venice. It is clean, and well run and the breakfast is good. I would not hesitate in staying there again and would definitely recommend to others. I understand the hotel is seeking an additional star to become a four star hotel. In my opinion it is well deserving of such a rating,

Reviews.Title: “Stylish convenient hotel in the historic heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: stoatsbrother
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our 2 kids in room 301 - decent size (kids beds in the same room as us). Stylish and traditional. Very helpful and welcoming staff. Ideally sited. Water Taxi to the airport booked at our request and worked perfectly. Breakfast ok - if area slightly small. I think this place represents pretty decent value for Venice. Any one who reviews this hotel and then complains about the overall cost of Venice needs to choose a cheaper - but less splendid city to head to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Steamy Venice”
Reviews.Author: jojoinca
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based upon many reviews from Tripadvisor. We needed accomodations that would fit the whole family into one room. We had a junior suite over looking the canal with balcony. Good size room. Bathroom was nice and clean. Just a side note, beds were horribly hard but that must be an Italian thing because our bed in Rome was hard as well. Location was excellent and we walked everywhere and bought a water bus pass for 2 days. The staff was very professional, especially Eleanora. Breakfast was served in a little room off the lobby and had a good selection of meats, pastries, cereal, yogurt and cheese. If you book here, you will not be disappointed but it is not an upscale, boutique hotel. Happy Traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful - the perfect Venice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: helo-papa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this on TripAdvisor - exceeded our expectations. We arrived by water taxi right to the hotel landing - how romantic. Great location in San Marco - only two years old. The staff -Eleanora, Anna, and Paulo - was professional and genuinely friendly, and even provided us with maps and directions. Breakfast was a fine selection in a small room overlooking the canal. We had a room overlooking the canal and were serenaded by passing gondolas with accordians and singers. The room so comfortable and classy. What struck us was how quiet the hotel was - we slept like logs. It was a wonderful place to come back to after a day of walking. We want to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: quanster
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, but on a quiet side street, and next to a gorgeous quiet canal, Anna noted that it was a special occasion and gave us a beautiful room with a balcony overlooking the canal. The room was small but comfortable and while hotels in Venice are expensive, this seemed reasonable in comparison to other hotels I researched. The breakfast was perfect, in a cozy little room. Anna couldn't have been more welcoming, charming and beautiful! Thank you Hotel Becher!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: luczen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Becher hotel for 5 days . I found everything perfect ; the location near the Fenice and near San Marco Very clean ; the lady very helpfull; speaks several languages. I took a watertaxi from the airport(very expensive at 95â‚¬) who drops you at the hotel because they have an "embarcadaire" right on the canal. The only minus is the room I stayed was small for one person OK but not for two

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OSUBuckeyesNJ
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Becher for two nights prior to taking a Greek Isles cruise. Anna and Paulo were most gracious from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. They gave us great restaurant recommendations, maps and directions and outstanding service. Our room was quite spacious and overlooked the canal. We were able to watch the gondoliers serenade their passengers. The hotel is close enough to the Piazza San Marco and other popular sites, but far enough away to avoid the crowds and noise. The continental breakfast was very good. There was plenty of food (pastries, cereal, fruit, meats and cheeses). The staff in the breakfast room were very attentive and made a great cup of cappuccino. We would definitely stay at the hotel again on a future trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: blueshoeskath
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel Becher, as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is very centrally located and it's very easy to access all the main sites and travel routes. Our room was spotlessly clean and had a canal view. It was a little on the small side but the authentic decorations made it seem quaint rather than pokey. The staff were fabulous; really friendly and helpful and all spoke perfect English (despite our vain attempts at Italian!). Breakfast is served in a small canal view room but this makes it very easy to get chatting to other guests so it has a very sociable feel. Athough quite expensive, our rate seemed to compare favourably with the other hotels I had researched in Venice. I would reccomend highly for a short break to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely people.”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelTennessee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Becher on June 7 and 8 with our two teenage children and another family with 3 teenagers. The hotel staff, especially the lovely woman manager (who I am sorry her name escapes me), were very helpful and friendly . The manager was so helpful with directions,even personally escorting us to a restaurant closeby on the first night! The hotel is very clean and the breakfast was delicious. The location is very convenient, also. Although the rooms are a bit small, which is probably typical for Venice anyway, we found them comfortable and quiet. Hotel Becher was a wonderful start to our Italian vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful start to the day”
Reviews.Author: jordansarah
Reviews.Content: At our request we had a canal side room and ate breakfast on the outside portico looking out on to the passing boats etc. - wonderful start to the day! Lovely clean, centrally placed hotel in a small side street within walking distance of the Rialto bridge and St Mark's Square. Staff very welcoming. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfection”
Reviews.Author: TomNC
Reviews.Content: Venice was our second Euro stop celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. I research very thoroughly and overall was well pleased with our hotels in Paris, Venice, Florence & Rome. Every positive comment written about Hotel Becher is absolutely true. It was a little piece of heaven after walking all over Venice.The married couple who run the hotel are extremely friendly and helpful. Oh, how I love that phrase, "as you wish". Becker is great for its location, solitude, service, cleanliness and given Venice's "touristic" prices, its also medium priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: P0P0LA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my boyfriend. It was great!! Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly! The rooms are just beautiful and charming! It made our trip even better! Really lovely experience. It's a little expensive, though - specially for two students, but I thought it was definitly worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: redsamp11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor and were not disappointed. We were very warmly greeted by name when we walked in and the staff/owners were friendly throughout the entire visit. We had the large family room with the balcony that overlooked the canal which my children loved! The room was very spacious which was nice with a 5 and 3 year old. The breakfast was wonderful. The best part though was the location to St. Mark's square and all of the great shopping. I would highly recommend Hotel Becher to my friends and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value in expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cathd100
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after lots of trawling through other hotel reviews and were not disappointed in any way. We were warmly greeted from the water taxi directly from the airport. This is a lovely way to arrive albeit a bit expensive. Our room overlooked the canal and was really spacious and spotlessly clean. Like another reviewer, we almost missed breakfast on the first morning as the room was so dark and quiet with the shutters closed!! Anna and all her staff really are delightful and this made our trip all the more special. The hotel really is a haven in a great location. The room rate is a bargain and it is well worth booking a larger room as the price difference is minimal. Thanks once again for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: FridayMonster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice in late Mar 09. The hotel was just great though the room was a bit small. The room was decorated with traditional Venice stuff. I love it very much! The staff was friendly and they even taught me to speak some Italian! Ciao!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: traveller5286
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay in Hotel Becher, and it was excellent. The room was fine, although not grand and the bathroom was well appointed. The lobby was light and airy and the hotel was obviously clean and well presented. The reception staff were delightful and could not have been more helpful, whether with trying to book trips, or giving advice on the best places to visit. Although the dining area for breakfast is small, it was never a problem and an adequate continental breakfast was served by very amenable staff. There is a very small terrace backing on to the canal, which is a pleasant place to watch the gondolas go by! The position of the hotel is excellent, within walking distance of St Mark's Square and next door to the Fenice, all the main sights of the city are easily accessible. We would certainly stay here again if we visit Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: odmjet
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Becher Hotel to celebrate my birthday. We had a taxi transfer from the airport straight to the Hotel's private landing stage, which made life very easy. I can't fault the hotel. The staff are lovely; nothing is too much trouble. Our room was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The hotel is centrally located and surrounded by shops and restaurants. St Mark's Square is only a five-minute walk away. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, some aspects of the room disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Barbeni
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because of the tripadvisor reviews, but was a little disappointed. Our room wasn't the biggest I've ever stayed in (a bit tight getting between the end of the bed & the furniture) & overlooked a tiny courtyard & other rooms. It was very clean & the bathroom was a good size but we were woken up by plumbing noise from other rooms every day. I found the bed a bit hard, although my husband didn't. It may just be that one room but it's something to be aware of. The breakfasts were nice, although there's limited space in the breakfast area, & the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, best service, rooms, staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Randa11
Reviews.Content: It tooks us a bit to find the hotel & the directions on the internet site sounded simple but really weren't. I would recommend getting a map as soon as you arrive at San Marco vaperetto stop to orinate yourself. You need to know that the street names change every block. If anyone would like more direction on finding your way to the hotel just send me a message. Staff was very helpful, easy to get along with and willing to do whatever it took to make you happy. We had trouble dialing out to the U.S so the hotel owner offered to come to our room and dial the phone for us. We had a canal view room and loved it. Room and hotel was very clean, quiet, we had an ensuite bathroom and was very sufficent. They offered free internet with a computer proviced in the breakfast room upstairs. Hotel had a lift, very small, not that many stairs so not difficult to walk the stairs. Our flight did not leave until 7pm and they were more then willing to hold our luggage for us free of charge. Would definately recomment this hotel to anyone and will definately stay again if we return. Breakfast was included and consisted of breads, fruit, cheeses, oatmeal, juices & coffee. You have got to try the pizza at the outside restaurant next to Rialto Bridge, the ham pizza is excellent. Absolutely loved this city and you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic, charming hotel in a great location! Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: acswift
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on a canal. We had the family room, which was one double bed and two singles. The hotel was beautiful and modern with great decor. The front desk staff was more than helpful and were the nicest ever! The bathrooms and rooms were very large compared to others I have seen abroad. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The room had 3 windows and the bathroom had its own window as well. Breakfast was included and very good, consisting of fresh coffee, fruits, meats, yogurt, breads and pasteries. The hotel provided a lounge with a computer with internet access for guest use. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone traveling to Venice wanting to stay near Saint Mark's Square!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Foxnv
Reviews.Content: Excellent 3-star rated hotel (it could easily pass for a higher rating) with nice amenities including an elevator. The best is the staff! They were very friendly and helpful. Always greeting you, and asking if there was anything they could do for you. The hotel is in a great location--50 meters from the opera and probably 300 meters from St Marks Square and the San Marco Giardinetti landing for the Alilaguna boat to and from the airport. If you so choose, the hotel also has a water taxi entrance. My only regret is not being able to stay there for the third night as I had an early flight at 0620 the next morning an chose to stay by the airport for convenience. Overall, you can not go wrong with a stay at the Hotel Becher

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dani44
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at Hotel Becher for two nights in March and absolutely loved it!! I cannot fault this hotel, it definitely exceeded our expectations (even after reading all the great reviews on Trip advisor) Upon arriving we were upgraded to a canal view room as we emailed them in advance requesting this. The view from our room was amazing and it was so lovely waking up in the morning, standing on our balcony and looking out at the canals watching the gondolas go by :) The rooms are absolutely immaculate, beds were very comfortable, flat screen TV was great, gorgeous chandler & DÃ©cor was beautiful!!! I read in a previous review that the room was very bright in the morning - there are shutters on both windows/doors you can close which make the room pitch black so this is untrue! We almost missed breakfast we slept in so long! Breakfast was great - croissants, coffee, juice, fruit (delicious peaches) cakes, biscuits & yoghurt. The breakfast room is a little squashy, it's best to get your food and sit upstairs where there is more room and you can watch the gondolas going by which is a nice touch! The hotel is in a fabulous location, 5 minutes walking to San Marco square & Rialto Bridge. Very easy to find! The staff were very helpful and friendly (and spoke very good English.) We asked for an adapter, they found us one right away. We asked to use the internet which they let us use free of charge. And we also asked to leave our luggage there after we had checked out which they were extremely nice about. We canâ€™t wait to go back to Venice and when we do we know where we will be staying! Hotel Becher is exceptional value for money. I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly, welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fionaaaaa
Reviews.Content: We truly loved our stay in Hotel Bercher. The staff were so lovely! The rooms were immaculate...we've never stayed in a cleaner hotel! On arrival we were presented with a bottle of champagne on ice and we were given a room with a canal view even though we'd opted for the cheaper non-canal room. It was lovely seeing the gondolas go floating past the window :) After two nights in that room, we decided to ask if we could be moved to a quieter room (there were a few motorboats going by late at night which kept waking us up!). They moved us to a lovely, quiet room which was slightly bigger too. The bathroom was very modern and clean. The showers were really nice (better then the one we have at home). Our first room had a shower over a bath, but the second had a spacious standup shower. The rooms had a modern flatscreen monitor style TV which we were able to use with our Archos player (for watching films and listening to music). Breakfast was great - croissants, fresh coffee, OJ, apples, oranges and little packets of muesli, cakes, biscuits and breads. It would definitely keep you going until lunch. Venice is an expensive place to eat so it was good to have a quick brekkie in the hotel. The hotel is in a brilliant location - only 5 minutes walking to San Marco square (this is the main tourist hub) and maybe 7 minutes to Rialto bridge (this is another tourist area but with slightly cheaper food). When you get off the waterbus, it's about 10 minutes walk from the canal with suitcases. Also, I didn't see many hotels that were right on a canal & had their own dock. It felt very old and atmospheric, but still clean and modern. The staff were so helpful, always glad to recommend cheap places to eat with good quality food. They were also able to help us find a quicker way back to the public waterbus which brought us to the bus terminus (and saved us about 45 minutes!). We loved our stay in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “nicest owners, perfect location, spotless, and great value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: kserasera7474
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and discovered at breakfast that everyone in the dining room had found it the same way. Every single guest we spoke with was so pleased with their rooms. We got upgraded to a junior suite and could hear the gondoliers on the canal for hours in the evening. It made our trip to Venice so special. We would highly recommend this hotel. L.S. Armonk, NY

Reviews.Title: “The icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: Surreytripper
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Becher in Venice for a long weekend in November 2008. Venice as a place to visit is absolutely beautiful but I will keep this review for the hotel. For us the Hotel Becher really was the icing on the cake, if the cake was Venice. We arrived late at night, having easily found the hotel from the directions given and were promptly and charmingly shown to our room by the night manager. He helped us with our bags and made sure we were happy with our room. The room was lovely. Quite large with a good size bathroom. Not what I was expecting from a typical Venice hotel room having read other hotels reviews on Tripadvisor. The room was immaculate as was the rest of the hotel as though it had been recently refurbished. The room was decorated very tastefully with a period feel to it. It had padded wall paper making it feel even more sumptuous. The room was very quiet and we heard no noise from other rooms. The safe in the room was free of charge, a novelty even in higher starred hotels. The bathroom again was spotless with a full bath and shower. Moving on to the staff, they were all very sweet and courteous. Also very good with tips on where to eat, where to get a good deal for a gondola ride and advice on getting back to the airport - which was easy anyway but it was nice to check. All in all a first class hotel. Highly recommended. Far far better than it's three stars would suggest. We hope to return to Venice one day and if we do we know where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY LITTLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TCYVirginia
Reviews.Content: We just spent two wonderful nights at the Hotel Becher. Everything was excellent. The location, right on a small canal, made arrival in a water taxi from the airport a wonderful (and expensive) way to start the visit. San Marco and the Rialto are both within very easy walking distance. We had a deluxe room with Canal view. The room was comfortably large and the canal view was a nice touch --- particularly when the singing gondaliers made their evening passes. The downside was that sleeping late is not an option due to the fact that canal traffic starts around 7am. The service provided by this family-operated hotel was all you could ask for. Every employee, from owner to chamber maid, was attentive and eager to please. They were ready with maps, directions and tourist advice. Restaurant recommendations were welcome and very accurate. (Try Vino Vino which is just around the corner and is a charming little cafe for a casual lunch or dinner.) The water taxi arranged by the hotel arrived precisely on time and took us directly to our cruise ship. The hotel breakfast was nothing special and the breakfast room is quite cozy. The coffee and cappucino were great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a romantic, canal-side location in Venice. We are really looking forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelingqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of November 2008. The room was clean and a decent size for a European Hotel. The location was also good, central to most sites and shopping. My husband and I are were not all that impressed with the hotel overall. The water took a very long time to get warm in the shower and sink. Also, the curtains in the room are so thin, the light comes in very early and wakes you up. Most of the front desk staff was not all that helpful in giving directions and other information. Also, there was a charge to use the internet. In others hotels we had stayed at in Italy, the internet could be used free of charge. Our room was above their outside dock on the canal. People hung out on the dock late at night and their loud chatter was very disturbing to us. We would not go back to this hotel, there are so many other ones in Venice to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireTwoBobs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous long weekend with four other friends in Venice. We chose the Hotel Becher from a newspaper review, but the very positive Trip Advisor feedback was what really clinched it. The hotel exceeded expectations. The service was first class from start to finish - rooms were spotless and well-furnished, and staff were always attentive and helpful. No tea making facilities in rooms for us Brits seemed to be a minus point, but a tray of tea to our room in the morning came bang on time with a rose - nice touch! Hotel is very central - 5 mins walk to St Mark's Square - and it's easy to wander to many attractions and good value restaurants recommended by hotel staff. One other great thing about the hotel is its private mooring, so you can arrive from the airport (and leave) in style by water taxi - good value if you are in a group.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, location, price”
Reviews.Author: jml66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife on our honeymoon in September 2008. We had a little trouble finding it on our arrival from San Marco (chalk that up to confusing Venice street addresses), but once we did it was wonderful. The location is excellent -- close to San Marco, very close to La Fenice. The rooms are charmingly decorated, and our window looked out on a busy little canal with passing gondolas and boats. The window blocks out the noise when it is closed, and the room was comfortable, though perhaps a little small. The morning breakfast was fine, and the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonedan
Reviews.Content: This Is a Lovely Hotel, literally 5 minutes walk from St Mark's Square, we stayed for 3 days and was given a VERY good rate, Beautiful Rooms which are cleaned daily, good continental breakfast and very helpful staff. Only very slight niggle, the breakfast room can be a little cosy - however on the occasion it was full we were offered to either have breakfast in our room or up on the first floor dining room overlooking the canal which was very nice. Reception staff were great, offering advice on where to buy goods(Very Expensive in St Mark's Sq), Vapporetto (Waterbus) routes etc... Would Definately stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A rare gem”
Reviews.Author: SJcolumnist
Reviews.Content: Pulled up to the dock of this hotel via water taxi, and were treated like visiting royalty from check-in to check-out. Husband and wife team at front desk spoke English well, and dedicated themselves to seeing that guests always had what they needed. They mailed postcards, carted out umbrellas during sudden thunderstorms, advised on restaurants, arranged tours, and oversaw a filling breakfast and exceptionally clean rooms. Had one of the few rooms with a balcony overlooking one of the side canals and a nearby footbridge so we saw lots of gondolas and happy people. One our family's best nights of two weeks in Italy. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Kbert77
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it took me this long to write a review of the Hotel Becher. My partner and I stayed there this spring. The room was beautiful, and comfortable with a great view of the canal and the sounds of gondolas passing by in the evening. It's tucked away on a quiet little street, but very close to everything you want to see...perfect for wandering around and getting lost in that magical city. Unfortunately while we were in Venice, my partner got very sick (not at all related to Italy). The owners were amazingly sympathetic and helpful. They located a doctor - who also wound up being fantastic- who made a house call to our hotel room. When it became clear that we would have to return home to New York after just 2 days (We had planned for 2 weeks in Italy) the owners were devastated for us, and did everything to make us as comfortable as possible. They did not even charge any penalties for early departure, in spite of the fact that they would have been totally within their rights to do so. Looking at the photos and reviews here on trip advisor I'm reminded what a great place the Becher is and how we cannot wait to get back there!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff but beware when traveling with kids”
Reviews.Author: emma4646
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights a the Becher Hotel in Venice after doing a lot of research on the web. The positive reviews on www.tripadvisor.com helped us make our decision. We have 2 children:8 year old and 10 month old at the time.On the hotel website,we saw a "family room" that seemed right for us so I reserved it. When we checked in,we were given a tiny room that did not look anything like the "family room" on the hotel website. There was no space to put our suitcase/no space to walk around the bed since there was a baby cot and a single rollaway bed in the room. To my surprise,when I asked the front desk,I was told that it was the family room...I doubt it though. As it turned out,the room given to us only had a shower in the room which was a problem(with a baby) so I asked to have another room with a bath tub.The hotel staff graciously accepted and put us in another room which ended up being the "family room" we saw on the website.This room was more spacious and adequate for our family. Our stay at the hotel was not ruined thanks to this change of "rooms". Had we stayed in the 1st room,it would have been a nightmare.Unfortunately,I cannot recall the number of the 1st room(tiny box).I don't know why they put our family of 4 in that tiny box in the 1st place. I suppose that the room size would not be a major issue if you are just 2 adults but when you have kids...it does matter. Aside from that,the staff at the hotel was lovely and helpful.The location of the hotel was very good.The private landing dock is a plus for those taking water taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, well priced”
Reviews.Author: robinpark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Venice, close to San Marco Piazza and 5 mins walk from pretty much everything in Venice. We had a triple room - a bit on the small side, but as you expect in Europe. Very clean, air-conditioned and good facilities. Staff are superb, very friendly and helpful. We paid Euro 260 for triple room in high season, and considered that a good rate. We caught the standard ferry from the airport on arrival, and took the water taxi back as we had an early flight. The water taxi was expensive, Euro 110 for 3 people (Ferry is 10 per person) - BUT it was a great trip, saw lots of canals, etc - better than taking a gondola ride.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder Hotel Becher”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller004
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at Hotel Becher in Venice. We arrived late in the evening, but found the hotel easily following the directions on their web site. Our room was small, but perfectly finished and immaculately clean. The breakfast room was as lovely as all other review described and the food was fresh and lovely. It is a treat to have fresh coffee made for you, and to look out over the canal. We found the location of the Becher perfect for the exploring the whole of Venice, especially as it was very close to the Rialto bridge. For anyone looking for some simple yet absolutely delicious food, there is a small Osteria called Vivaldi on the far side of the Rialto bridge, which served perhaps some of the best food I have ever had. This Osteria is written up in most of the main tourist books, but wasn't busy, so it is definitely worth hunting out. I can also recommend hunting out some of the quieter area such as Dorsoduro and Zattere, and also head up to Cannaregio for a different view of Venice. I loved Venice so much and hope to visit again soon. I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Becher again, and would highly recommend it to anyone heading to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: issylh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely lovely, with beautiful decor, great location and friendly owners. The adjoining canal is a popular route in the early evening for the gondolas. Absolutely charming, just as their pictures show! Owners speak english quite well and are very friendly and helpful. The location is absolutely perfect for getting around to all the major sites while still being in a quaint location on a small side street. The internet access is easy with a minimal charge and the "continental breakfast" was wonderful! Pasteries as well as cereal, cheeses, salame-much nicer than expected. We did not want to leave! A plus is that you can take the water taxi directly to the front door, elminating having to drag our luggage down the streets as we saw so many others having to do. HIGHLY recommend!!!!! All the rooms are lovely, but the balconies rooms are extra fun for watching the gondolas go by and hearing the singing of the gondaliers. Won't stay anywhere else if we ever get back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and romantic”
Reviews.Author: amateurephotographer
Reviews.Content: A nice place in the most romantic city we've visited yet. Rooms are larger than in general in europe. Clean, quiet, home-like breakfast. Private dock is something you do not appreciate utill you are actually in Venice....with 3 heavy suitcases and 3 "lighter" bags. If you travel with luggage, take the water taxi, it will take right into the hotel reception area. It cost around $170 though, but is a nice ride through the city and the lagoon. Problem with the water bus (~$25 per person) is that you need to walk...and carry luggage through the narrow streets and across the bridges. There are no such a thing as a car in Venice, you walk from any point of landing. If you travel light water bus is OK, the streets in Venice are covered with large flat stones and the luggage can be wheeled for long distance. The bridges are a challenge for heavy stuff... We also recommend travelling light if you plan internal flights in Europe: limit is 20kg with a charge >$20 per extra kg. Venice was unexpected surprise after Rome (which was dirty, unmaintained, frankly unfriendly and dangerous at nights). If you want a romantic place, it is Venice. People complain of the smell, we did not feel much in May. Any kind of shops you can imagine, clean streets, friendly people. Restaraunts get cheaper away from the square and Grand Canal. Gondola ride is a must. Will cost you another $160, but it is the real one, not the Vegas imitation. Try operas and concerts. Although they are set up in small places with limited decorations, venetians can sign and play music! There is no other language which is meant for singing, but italian. Our next stop was Moscow, and it was clear that Russian should not be used for opera. They can play music, and make costumes/decorations, but can't change language rhythm. Have not heard an italian opera in Bolshoi though....

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: evelynyeager
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher is a delightful hotel on a minor canal on the island(s) of Venice. It is very clean and well kept. They included a complimentary breakfast of the ususal European fair. The staff was very helpful in answering questions and brought us extra pillows when asked. It was styled in the fancy Venitian style I hoped for. Our room faced the canal and the bridge...so we had to make sure the shades were drawn when changing...but that was nothing compared to the joy of listening to singing gondolaiers as they sailed underneath our window! I couldn't figure out what the bright shocks of light were (for a while) as it couldn't possibly be lightening...but then I realized it was camera flashes from the bridge down our beautiful canal. The only downs were the room was on the small side and the staff should make a map from the vaparetto to the hotel which only passes over one bridge (for those of us hauling luggage) We figured out this was possible as opposed to the three bridges in the map the hotel provides on line.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location to stay at in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JTBGMO
Reviews.Content: We started off our trip in Italy at this Venice Hotel. We selected Hotel Becher based off of trip advisor reviews and this hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was extremely helpful and gracious. We had had lots of questions and they assisted without hesitation. The room type we reserved overlooked a quiet canal and was worth the extra cost. Others in our party did not have a canal view and were also pleased with their accommodations. The hotel and rooms were clean and nicely decorated in Venetian style (beds a little hard, but still got a great night's rest), the European breakfast options were excellent and the canal entrance made it even more unique for us when we were picked up by our water taxi. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little place!”
Reviews.Author: gingernatorgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Becher last weekend and had a fantastic time. I'd scoured trip advisor for days back in Oct and read so many tales of places in Venice which were not up to scratch/having to move rooms all the time etc and picked Hotel Becher because of the positive comments on trip advisor and it was definitely a good choice! I booked using their online web site nearly 6mths beforehand and contacted them via email also to let them know i'd like a canal room. I also contacted them a couple of times before about getting to/leaving the hotel as there was an event on the Sun which meant all the public transport was not working and received very prompt, friendly replies with all the info I required so top marks there! We arrived by water taxi which was fantastic!! 115EUROS which I think is worth it (cost us 6 EUROS to go back to Marco Polo by bus - so it evens out the cost). Taxi dropped us at the landing stage of the hotel (not many places seem to have these, so it made it lovely!) and were able to leave our bags at reception until our room was ready at 2. The room was fairly small, but was decorated in lovely Venetian style and more importantly was v clean and new and a nice clean bright modern bathroom. We had 2 windows looking onto the canal which were perfect - when we were having a afternoon nap at 6ish before dinner, we could listen to the gondola's singing up and down and spent most evenings waving to people as they floated by, was great! Heard lots of people saying "why aren't we staying in that hotel?! The owners were very friendly and able to speak great English and helped us with any queries we had.... couldn't fault them at all. I also sent a thank you email to them and received a lovely reply.... Location was briliant too - not far from San Marco, Rialto, across to Dorsoduro or to walk to the other side to catch the boat to Murano/Burano/Torchello.... We ate in Alla Maddonna, near Rialto, down an alleyway which was very nice, basic but good food and authentic (not like the tourist traps right next to Rialto) and Bancogiro which was fantastic - near the Rialto market...great food, not too many tourists, v romantic and great service...lots of bars round this area too, full of locals drinking spritz (orange coloured - apersol & wine) Would definitely recommend it as it's not too expensive, very cute and lovely...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: appoloCrete
Reviews.Content: Following a booking error we were moved to the Becher, imagine our pleasure on finding such a welcoming and helpful staff, pleasant and comfortable rooms and public areas. The breakfast offered was comprehensive, the best coffee we had anywhere during our stay. The hotel is clean and the management and staff friendly and informative. Located in the city centre within a few minutes walk of St. Mark's square makes it an ideal place to stay. We would highly recommend this hotel and were not disappointed to have been moved to it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat_AnneCork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Becher in October 2007 and April 2008 and can recommend it unreservedly. We had room 310 which opened onto the adjacent canal, with three french windows, a long balcony and a beautiful palazzo opposite. Anna and Paolo were perfect hosts and gave us valuable advice on what to visit, recommendations on restaurants, etc. The hotel is almost equidistant from St. Mark's Square, the Ponte Accademia and the Rialto Bridge close to La Fenice. It is close to everything with excellent restaurants and shopping areas less than two minutes away and a wonderful atmosphere in the locality. We loved waking to the sounds of the city stirring and beginning its day with the light seeping through our windows. To arrive and leave by water taxi was truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful intimate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pve2814
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Becher. Our family of four ended our visit to Italy in Venice at the Hotel Becher. It's a lovely boutique hotel. Our family shared a large room that was clean and tastefully decorated, Venetian style (my daughter wants to decorate her room just like it). Our hosts, Anna and Paulo were warm and kind. We enjoyed the fact that the hotel was centrally located to everything yet hidden away from the noise. If you want to stay at an intimate friendly hotel then Hotel Becher is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Private Landing on Quiet Canal”
Reviews.Author: alongtheroad
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Becher is a beautiful hotel with its own private water taxi landing. This was important to us since we needed a private water taxi ride back to the airport at 3:30 a.m. for a 6:00 a.m. flight, before public water taxis were running. Turns out we didn't need to leave that early since the airport wasn't even open for about 45 minutes once we arrived! Anyway, the hotel is very nice, but in spite of booking a double and a triple room the December prior to our July stay, once we arrived we were told they had overbooked and our kids' room was available, but ours was not and they put us in the Hotel Mercurio right across the street for the first night of our two night stay. This was disappointing as it was not as nice, and not on the water. Plus, workers on the roof began pounding at 8:30 a.m. on the one morning we wanted to sleep in. Luckily though, the Hotel Becher made up for it for our second night, and provided us with a very nice, luxurious suite, overlooking the water, to accommodate our entire family before our early morning departure for the airport, which they arranged for us. The location was great for easy walking to St. Mark's Square, Rialto Bridge, and many wonderful shopping and eating areas. Plus, we loved walking out from our room onto one of their few balconies to see the gondolas float by below.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Becher was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SachaSydney
Reviews.Content: I found it very difficult to select a hotel for our stay in Venice. After spending many hours viewing the Trip Advisor recommendations I finally settled on Hotel Becher. The owners assured us a good rate and a comfortable room. I was travelling with my 13 year old daughter on her first trip to Europe. It was very important to me that our accomodation was good, comfortable and affordable. We were happy to share a queen bed. Both of us were very pleased with our choice. We had only 2 nights and 3 days in Venice. Both the Hotel Becher and Venice far exceeded our expectations. Hotel Becher was actually the best hotel we stayed in on our 4 week holiday. It was close to St Marc's Square which saved us a lot of time getting around. We found we could race back to the hotel for a quick break or to unload our shopping. We travelled by water taxi from the airport to the hotel and again on our return trip to the airport. This was fantastic because it was easy and quick, comfortable and private. We thoroghly enjoyed our ride despite the expense. Hotel Becher was very comfortable, spotlessly clean, our room was large enough to be more than comfortable and the bathroom a very good size for Europe. The Venetian decor was delightful and our room overlooked the canal. The continental breakfasts were delicious and of a high standard. Everything was fresh and of a high quality. The breakfast room was tiny but we didn't have any problems getting a table each morning. It was very cosy and clean. Our hosts were very friendly and helpful. They were able to advise a good restaurant very close by. On our last day we were able to leave our luggage in the foyer until our flight in the afternoon. This was very helpful. We would return here without any doubt. The only request I would have on my next visit would be for a room with a balcony. It would also be great to have internet access from the room. It was available in the guest lounge. A longer stay next time is a must!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel05
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Venice, I booked this hotel as a surprise 3 night short break for my partner's 40th birthday. We were both very impressed at what the hotel has to offer for a 3 star rating. I would echo other traveller's reviews to say that the most stylish & hassle free way to arrive in Venice is by private water taxi. True, it's expensive but in my opinion worth every Euro as you truly do feel like you're in a James Bond film ! We stayed in a superior canal view room which was spotlessly clean & very beautifully decorated. A good sized bathroom with a great shower over the bath. Toiletries were provided but not replenished each day. Breakfast was simple but adequate. The dining room is very small and although we had no trouble securing a table each morning, I would imagine this could be a very different story during the busier months of the year ! The hotel's location is fantastic. Within short walking distance of the major sights & of some lovely restaurants. We asked at reception for a recommendation of a good fish restaurant & were advised to go to Vino Vino. It was only a few minutes walk from the hotel and was excellent. We would have no hesitation in returning to Hotel Becher should we ever have the chance to return to romantic & beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Hotel Becher”
Reviews.Author: traveleatlove
Reviews.Content: Hotel Becher was great for our family trip to Venice. We had a quad room in the front corner of the building. The hotel is well located near the Theatre La Fenice and about 5 minutes from St. Mark's Square. With only 18 rooms the hotel is quiet and relaxing with a good breakfast. The front desk people are very nice but were not able to recommend places to eat which is really our only negative issue with the hotel. The hotel is on a canal and has it's own gondola landing. We took the vaporetti (water bus) and got off at the Vallaresso-St. Mark's stop. The hotel is about 7 minute walk from there. An alternative is to take a water taxi which can bring you directly to the hotel. We packed light so walking with roll-aboard suitcases was not too difficult. We learned that the building had been a private residence until only 1 1/2 years ago. An older couple owned the residence and the husband was a Director of La Fenice. They used to throw fancy parties and dinners for the theatre crowd. When the husband died, his widow sold the building but still maintains a flat for herself in the building. The bathrooms are therefore brand new and the walls are upholstered in fabric in a venetian style. The whole property feels more like a home than a hotel! It was fun learning the history! Hotel Becher is a good value for the money in Venice....and you feel you are really experiencing a Venetian home!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Mypinkparis
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days in October 07. Thinking it wouldn't be a problem to arrive by the waterbus from the airport, we set out on our journey from the San marco Stop. First of all, it was pouring rain out. I had directions to the hotel which at one point proved to be useless. Venice maps and US maps are totally different. It took us probably 1/2 hour to get the hotel with all our luggage. To me this is not a convenient location if you are carrying luggage, kids, etc. except if you are using an extremely expensive water taxi to use their dock. Upon arriving, the owner (paulo) didn't even acknowledge that we were sopping wet and near tears because of the problems of getting to the hotel. Our pants were wet to our knees! We were checked into the hotel though and made our way upstairs. The room was beautiful, however I feel unworthy of the 210 euros we spent off season and didn't even get a canal view. It was very clean and the bathtub was clean, however we didn't have a bathtub which I felt for the money there should have been a tub. I think we started off on the wrong foot with them because I plugged in my adapter and camera charger and the circuit blew and the lights went out. This has never happened to me in all of my European travels. Needless to say, I don't think Paulo was to happy with us and felt the frostiness for the rest of the time we were there. The wife, (never knew her name) however was much nicer and spoke with us more. We were supposed to have full internet access and they could never get it to work. In fact every one that worked there thought we were crazy and said they knew nothing about computers and we must be doing something wrong. this was disappointing since we needed some form of internet and I made sure when I booked that the hotel would have internet. After the lights issue, maybe they thought we broke that also. Breakfast was ok, canned fruit with meat, bread, etc. After 3 days was very tired of it though because there was no change in the variety. I think I would have fonder thoughts of the hotel until the next week I stayed at another Venice hotel for 50 euros less a night and it didn't even compare to this one. This hotel was gorgeous though, the common areas were beautiful and location is one of the best in Venice. (Not including how far it is from a vaparatto stop). There were stunning venetian chandeliers in each room. All in all, not a horrible hotel but I would never stay there again with the other amazing choices in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “nice place for independent travellers”
Reviews.Author: acer33
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights and felt comfortable and free, being able to roam about easily from the hotel location. We arrived by water taxi, saving us the hassle of finding a small hotel in the labyrinth of small streets and canals crisscrossing the city. Taxi fare is a bit steep 70 -80 Euro but worth it if it's your first visit. Staff (owners?) were very friendly and helpful - even provided us with a free trip to the glass factory in Murano! Shower cubicle very small, but otherwise very clean and modern bathroom. Breakfast was great, and we particularly loved the freshly brewed coffee and the variety of fresh fruit. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great location, friendly staff, and the right ambience of Venice without having to spend a big slice of their holiday money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tourist2traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very good value for the money in Venice. We paid 210 euros a night for a canal room which was lovely. We could see the gondolas pass our window and hear the singing. Most of the gondola drivers looked bored out of their mind but I still didnt mind seeing their striped shirts on beuatiful gondolas right outside my window. The room size was good and very charming. Oh, the breakfast was good too. My complaints are as follows but really minor compared to the positiveness of the hotel. The hotel lobby smells a bit like the canals...sulphur-esque. I guess you cant really help that when the hotel is basically on the side canal. The staff didnt seem too knowledgable about the city. She could not give us any particular restaurant recommendations or knew exactly how the allugunas worked (public taxi to the airport). Other than that, the hotel was really great for the money in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would probably be nice if you got a comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: sunbeam84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Becher for 2 nights, October 11 and 12. We stayed there with 2 other couples. All 3 couples were booked in a room described as a double room with a large bed. The other 2 couples received very comfortable rooms with king beds. My husband and I got a corner room with a double bed stuck in the corner. All three of us checked in at the same time and our confirmations were taken by the front desk person, so there was no question that the same reservation was made for everyone. My husband is 6'2'', so the bed was far too small for him. I spent 2 nights huddled in the corner against the wall. Plus we heard the construction outside that began around 8AM. Needless to stay, our stay was extremely uncomfortable. The hotel was sold out, so there were no other rooms. When I expressed my displeasure with the stay upon checkout, the desk clerk looked at me like I had 2 heads. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: cmstvl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three lovely nights at the Hotel Becher. The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom large and spotless. We had a view of the canal and could have just sat for hours to watch the world go by and to hear the wonderful music. Anna and Paolo were most helpful and efficient. Do recommend that you take the water taxi to the hotel since the walk from the Vaporetto could be a bit taxing with luggage. The hotel is perfectly located and quiet. Right near La Fenice and many restaurants and a very short stroll to San Marco. A bargain for Venice. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great -- up until checkout”
Reviews.Author: Albany_GATraveler
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed three nights at Hotel Becher in early October. I would agree with everyone else that this is a lovely little hotel in an excellent location. Everyone was very nice, and the breakfast was good. Our problems came at check out time. We had a 6:30 AM train to Rome. I talked with the girl at the front desk (I don't know her name) about transportation to the train station. Since the vaporetti do not run that early, we had to opt for a water taxi. She arranged for the taxi to be at the hotel at 5:45 AM. We confirmed the arrangements the afternoon and night before our departure. When we got downstairs to check out of the hotel at 5:30, it took over 20 minutes to check out as the man at the desk could not get a receipt to print. The water taxi was waiting on us and we hopped on at 5:50 AM. However, instead of taking us to the train station as was supposed to be arranged, he took us to the airport as this is where the Hotel Becher staff had told him we needed to go. As you can imagine, I nor the taxi driver was very happy about this large mistake. We did make it on the train -- with three minutes to spare, but it is simply a mistake that should not have happened.

Reviews.Title: “Such a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: JeanniesDiary
Reviews.Content: What can I say but what a fabulous place to stay in Venice! We were upgraded to a canal room which was absolutely wonderful. The singing gondoliers and piano accordians could be heard all through the day and night which was delightful. Our room was also really large and spotlessly clean, with a nice bathroom and everything we could possibly need. Breakfast also was great. The location perfect, staff very helpful. I've travelled Europe a lot and this is by far my favourite hotel. I'll be recommending this as the place to stay for anyone who mentions Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Hotel Becher”
Reviews.Author: windsweptIreland
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent four nights at Hotel Becher in August. A lovely cosy hotel, very central, but far from the madding crowds. We had two rooms, very small, but perfectly formed!. .Best thing about this hotel and what in my mind sets it apart from many other hotels is the warmth of Anna and Paolo. So welcoming and friendly, thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed the cosy atmosphere of the becher Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vandenBogaard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Becher Hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. The Becher hotel is a small hotel with only 17 rooms and it is romantic and fits in perfectly well with Venice. We sent them a mail asking for a room overlooking the canal and this is what we got. It was a lovely small but very nice room on the first floor so we were almost face to face with the condoliers. in the mornigs we woke up to the singing of the condoliers which was quite an experience. Breakfast was good with fresh coffee made to order. Hotel staff is very friendly and makes you feel at ease from the moment you walk in. The hotel is ideally situated within a few minutes walking of both the Rialto Bridge and the San Marco Square. Prices are very reasonable. We booked our flights first and started checking prices after that. It proved difficult to find reasonably prices hotels. At the Becher hotel we paid â‚¬ 185,- per night. Overall it has been a very enjoyable stay. Would i stay there next time? No, but only because i do not like staying in the same hotels twice. But i can thoroughly recommend the Becher hotel. We are from Amsterdam and Vebice was marvelous; No bikes, trams, buses, metro, cars, trucks, etc. Only walking and boats. A very welcome change and it was extremely relaxing.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Becher
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1857, 30010 Venice, Italy
